subject: Test tenant network resources are isolated from each other
revisions:
[{'number': 4, 'created': '2014-01-15 13:16:04.000000000', 'files': ['tempest/scenario/manager.py', 'tempest/scenario/test_tenant_resource_isolation.py'], 'message': 'Test tenant network resources are isolated from each other

This test fundamentally proves networks owned by a tenant
are not visible to another tenant (i.e. no leaks). Where as
the admin can see networks of both.

Change-Id: I60fbc8bc1b4e506a73082e585730ac25516b8bfb
'}]
commit_message:
Test tenant network resources are isolated from each other

This test fundamentally proves networks owned by a tenant
are not visible to another tenant (i.e. no leaks). Where as
the admin can see networks of both.

Change-Id: I60fbc8bc1b4e506a73082e585730ac25516b8bfb

commit_message:
Disable HPET Explicitly for VMs in KVM

This commit explicitly disables HPET for all VMs
when running under KVM, as per the KVM devs' reccomendation
(all guests should use '--no-hpet' option).

Change-Id: I81c20c652fbc28386a51561f75b96334bab2b812
Implements: blueprint add-no-hpet-option-into-guest-clock

Closes-Bug: #1259267
Closes-Bug: #1261021

commit_message:
Nova Docker: Metadata service doesn't work

The metadata services rejects the request because the remote IP address
belongs to the docker network. The remote IP address is correct by using
the nova network as default route.

Change-Id: I410a9bfea560f669515b31db7f007515b4d5c4e7
Closes-Bug: #1259267
Closes-Bug: #1261021

commit_message:
Destroy docker container if spawn fails to set up network

If docker driver failed to set up network when spawn an instance,
then the docker driver should also destroy the container to make
sure no garbage container left for such case.

Change-Id: I4496182d9f6a9bfd86b0a32edb19dcd975467e91
Closes-Bug: #1242815

commit_message:
Adding override.config.template for percona

After the 'adding configuration group support' patch was merged,
percona instance-create is failing because the TM cannot find
the override.config.template for percona. Adding this template
fixes the problem.

Change-Id: I63404cfa8cd9bd850e4fc7457a3d4bcc2711685c
Closes-Bug: #1277376

reviewers: [{'_account_id': 3, 'name': 'Jenkins', 'username': 'jenkins'}, {'_account_id': 642, 'name': 'Matt Dietz', 'email': 'matthew.dietz@gmail.com', 'username': 'cerberus'}, {'_account_id': 782, 'name': 'John Garbutt', 'email': 'john.garbutt@stackhpc.com', 'username': 'johngarbutt'}, {'_account_id': 5441, 'name': 'Andrew Laski', 'email': 'andrew@lascii.com', 'username': 'alaski'}, {'_account_id': 6735, 'name': 'Bob Ball', 'email': 'bob.ball@citrix.com', 'username': 'bob-ball'}, {'_account_id': 6904, 'name': 'Guillaume Thouvenin', 'email': 'gthouvenin@mirantis.com', 'username': 'guillaume-thouvenin'}, {'_account_id': 9578, 'name': 'DB Datasets CI', 'email': 'turbo-hipster@lists.rcbops.com', 'username': 'turbo-hipster', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}]
revisions:
[{'number': 9, 'created': '2014-02-05 23:55:09.000000000', 'files': ['nova/virt/xenapi/driver.py', 'nova/virt/xenapi/client/session.py', 'etc/nova/nova.conf.sample', 'nova/virt/xenapi/vm_utils.py', 'nova/virt/xenapi/fake.py', 'nova/tests/virt/xenapi/test_vm_utils.py', 'plugins/xenserver/xenapi/etc/xapi.d/plugins/nova_plugin_version', 'plugins/xenserver/xenapi/etc/xapi.d/plugins/xenhost'], 'message': 'XenAPI: Monitor the GC when coalescing

Add a new host plugin to monitor whether the garbage collector is running.
This is then used by the wait_for_vhd_coalesce function to know whether
waiting any more is likely to produce the expected results.

Increased the number of times we loop waiting for coalesce as the loop
now has knowledge that something is still happening.

DocImpact
Change to parameter default.

Change-Id: Idcc0738945bd1aee8cdb52c9cfabd798f85c31db
Closes-bug: 1258169
'}]
commit_message:
XenAPI: Monitor the GC when coalescing

Add a new host plugin to monitor whether the garbage collector is running.
This is then used by the wait_for_vhd_coalesce function to know whether
waiting any more is likely to produce the expected results.

Increased the number of times we loop waiting for coalesce as the loop
now has knowledge that something is still happening.

DocImpact
Change to parameter default.

Change-Id: Idcc0738945bd1aee8cdb52c9cfabd798f85c31db
Closes-bug: 1258169

commit_message:
Update for doc-tools 0.6

We can do now everything in the tox file and thus minimize the
content in the jenkins file.

This needs sitepackages set since gneratedocbook needs xml2po
which cannot be installed in the venv. Since it's installed in
the system, let's use sitepackages.

Change-Id: I8c9d578c069ecd55ce9c6abe9e8d48e666962c20

revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2014-02-07 00:29:21.000000000', 'files': ['neutron/plugins/hyperv/agent/hyperv_neutron_agent.py'], 'message': 'Fixes XML serialization issue in Hyper-V agent

The XML API marshalling is not able to serialize dicts with
key values containing "*", being an invalid value for an
XML element.

This fix replaces the dictionary containing the mappings with
the corresponing string representation as speciafied in the
AGENT.physical_network_vswitch_mappings option value.

Change-Id: I477073992be911e0f24d886067c20f097c8561a9
Closes-Bug: #1277285
'}]
commit_message:
Fixes XML serialization issue in Hyper-V agent

The XML API marshalling is not able to serialize dicts with
key values containing "*", being an invalid value for an
XML element.

This fix replaces the dictionary containing the mappings with
the corresponing string representation as speciafied in the
AGENT.physical_network_vswitch_mappings option value.

Change-Id: I477073992be911e0f24d886067c20f097c8561a9
Closes-Bug: #1277285

commit_message:
Dynamic pipelines for server configuration

This patch allows admins of systems who use software that
generates/controls swift config files to add items to an existing swift
configuration that uses the conf.d-style without intruding on the
managing system.  This is done by adding a new config file in the
config.d directory with a filter section declared in it, and explicitly
declaring the ordering dependencies of that filter with other items in
the pipeline.

Other features:

Dynamic pipelines rendered under conf.d only
Added config.d documentation to proxy-server man page

Change-Id: Ia5282091a7c72f884e67e25514b7dab98c6c5702

subject: Avoid deadlock when stringifying NetworkInfo model
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2014-02-05 23:00:41.000000000', 'files': ['nova/virt/libvirt/driver.py'], 'message': "Avoid deadlock when stringifying NetworkInfo model

In the libvirt driver, we log information about the instance we're
about to generate XML for, which includes a NetworkInfo model. In
reality, this is a NetworkInfoAsyncWrapper which acquires a lock
on the model. Since we're in the middle of a log statement, we also
hold the logging lock. This happens right after we've fired off an
async request to update information about the instance, which first
acquired the network model lock and then acquired the logging lock
to make a seemingly innocuous log record.

The resulting deadlock is fixed by this patch by stringifying the
NetworkInfo object before making the log call in the libvirt
driver.

Change-Id: I81f35197ab7c74daa84fb51fbaa2df28c025da13
Closes-bug: 1276268
(cherry picked from commit 072e4ad20a6a7f4fff3b59eb7ef3f6fef9aa19d1)
"}]
commit_message:
Avoid deadlock when stringifying NetworkInfo model

In the libvirt driver, we log information about the instance we're
about to generate XML for, which includes a NetworkInfo model. In
reality, this is a NetworkInfoAsyncWrapper which acquires a lock
on the model. Since we're in the middle of a log statement, we also
hold the logging lock. This happens right after we've fired off an
async request to update information about the instance, which first
acquired the network model lock and then acquired the logging lock
to make a seemingly innocuous log record.

The resulting deadlock is fixed by this patch by stringifying the
NetworkInfo object before making the log call in the libvirt
driver.

Change-Id: I81f35197ab7c74daa84fb51fbaa2df28c025da13
Closes-bug: 1276268
(cherry picked from commit 072e4ad20a6a7f4fff3b59eb7ef3f6fef9aa19d1)

subject: Rename self.tgtadm to self.target_helper
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2014-02-06 21:07:20.000000000', 'files': ['cinder/volume/driver.py', 'cinder/volume/drivers/block_device.py', 'cinder/tests/test_iscsi.py', 'cinder/volume/drivers/lvm.py'], 'message': 'Rename self.tgtadm to self.target_helper

Using "tgtadm" for this member variable is confusing because it
actually represents tgt, IET, and LIO.  Rename to a more generic
term to make things more readable.

Also remove "tgtadm" from method names and references in tests
where it is not tgtadm-specific.

I'm choosing the name "target_helper" because "tgtadm" = tgtd,
and "iscsi_helper" doesn't fit when using RDMA in ISERDriver.

Change-Id: I73fab03eb6635be6b49950e3a0ccc0e9801697ca
'}]
commit_message:
Rename self.tgtadm to self.target_helper

Using "tgtadm" for this member variable is confusing because it
actually represents tgt, IET, and LIO.  Rename to a more generic
term to make things more readable.

Also remove "tgtadm" from method names and references in tests
where it is not tgtadm-specific.

I'm choosing the name "target_helper" because "tgtadm" = tgtd,
and "iscsi_helper" doesn't fit when using RDMA in ISERDriver.

Change-Id: I73fab03eb6635be6b49950e3a0ccc0e9801697ca

subject: Don't raise MySQL 2013 'Lost connection' errors
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2014-02-07 08:33:53.000000000', 'files': ['heat/openstack/common/db/sqlalchemy/session.py'], 'message': "Don't raise MySQL 2013 'Lost connection' errors

cherry pick, including original commit message below from
oslo-incubator commit:

b4f72b2987d53bb434e3a833f06d70a2167f5efc

Closes bug: 1275838

Although this code error is part of the `ping_listener` tests, it was
missing from the list of known - and ignored - connection errors.

The code error 2013 refers to a connection lost during a query, see:
https://dev.mysql.com/doc/refman/5.0/en/error-messages-client.html#error_cr_server_lost

Without this error code, the session won't try to reconnect to mysql,
which makes `max_retries` useless.

Change-Id: Id8a1c0665468b503b092c4f01ffd40e2be9c6fa9
"}]
commit_message:
Don't raise MySQL 2013 'Lost connection' errors

cherry pick, including original commit message below from
oslo-incubator commit:

b4f72b2987d53bb434e3a833f06d70a2167f5efc

Closes bug: 1275838

Although this code error is part of the `ping_listener` tests, it was
missing from the list of known - and ignored - connection errors.

The code error 2013 refers to a connection lost during a query, see:
https://dev.mysql.com/doc/refman/5.0/en/error-messages-client.html#error_cr_server_lost

Without this error code, the session won't try to reconnect to mysql,
which makes `max_retries` useless.

Change-Id: Id8a1c0665468b503b092c4f01ffd40e2be9c6fa9

revisions:
[{'number': 5, 'created': '2014-02-06 15:53:25.000000000', 'files': ['savanna/tests/unit/utils/test_edp.py', 'savanna/utils/edp.py'], 'message': 'Add utilities for supporting dotted job types

Dotted notation will allow job types to include subtype indicators,
for example MapReduce.Streaming.  With this facility, job types can
still parallel Oozie action types but contain indicators for variants
without affecting the API or database.

These utiltiy methods support extracting type and subtype and testing
a job type for membership in a list of job types.

Partial-implements: blueprint edp-dotted-job-types
Change-Id: I8d51d5567751959fb17f633a68175807b036dfb3
'}]
commit_message:
Add utilities for supporting dotted job types

Dotted notation will allow job types to include subtype indicators,
for example MapReduce.Streaming.  With this facility, job types can
still parallel Oozie action types but contain indicators for variants
without affecting the API or database.

These utiltiy methods support extracting type and subtype and testing
a job type for membership in a list of job types.

Partial-implements: blueprint edp-dotted-job-types
Change-Id: I8d51d5567751959fb17f633a68175807b036dfb3

Change-Id: I217d6b68a64ee008a82426b890a32a97b849cb4d
'}]
commit_message:
Typo in backwards compat names for notification drivers

The switch to oslo.messaging uses setup.cfg to provide a mapping
for the Nova notification drivers, but mis-spelt them.   This will
break any existing Nova systems that use notifictaions for things
like billing, monitoring, etc

Change-Id: I217d6b68a64ee008a82426b890a32a97b849cb4d

reviewers: [{'_account_id': 3, 'name': 'Jenkins', 'username': 'jenkins'}, {'_account_id': 1941, 'name': 'Lin Hua Cheng', 'email': 'os.lcheng@gmail.com', 'username': 'lin-hua-cheng'}, {'_account_id': 4264, 'name': 'Matthias Runge', 'email': 'mrunge@redhat.com', 'username': 'mrunge'}, {'_account_id': 5623, 'name': 'David Lyle', 'email': 'dklyle0@gmail.com', 'username': 'david-lyle'}, {'_account_id': 6230, 'name': 'Rob Raymond', 'email': 'rob.raymond@hp.com', 'username': 'rob-raymond'}, {'_account_id': 6914, 'name': 'Tatiana Ovchinnikova', 'email': 't.v.ovtchinnikova@gmail.com', 'username': 'tmazur'}, {'_account_id': 7781, 'name': 'Ala Rezmerita', 'email': 'ala.rezmerita@orange.com', 'username': 'alla'}]
revisions:
[{'number': 3, 'created': '2014-02-03 20:31:20.000000000', 'files': ['openstack_dashboard/dashboards/admin/metering/views.py', 'openstack_dashboard/dashboards/admin/metering/tabs.py'], 'message': 'Warn user when no meters in metrics panel

Avoid generating an exception by first checking if there is a
meter before calling replace method on it.
Give the user a nice warning if there are no meters available. This cannot be
done in the get method because this is an AJAX call to fetch JSON data.

Change-Id: I1536474c85083fb0bb3876e6650a3c928625a5c5
Closes-bug: #1274823
'}]
commit_message:
Warn user when no meters in metrics panel

Avoid generating an exception by first checking if there is a
meter before calling replace method on it.
Give the user a nice warning if there are no meters available. This cannot be
done in the get method because this is an AJAX call to fetch JSON data.

Change-Id: I1536474c85083fb0bb3876e6650a3c928625a5c5
Closes-bug: #1274823

subject: nova: use RequestContextSerializer for notifications
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2014-02-06 14:17:16.000000000', 'files': ['nova/rpc.py'], 'message': 'nova: use RequestContextSerializer for notifications

RequestContext should be serialized when sent via oslo.messaging. The
serializer is correctly used for the general RPC mechanism, but has been
forgotten in the notifier. This patch fixes that.

Change-Id: I56fa8022e34c0e80835e3bde940fda99ed0f9ba8
Closes-Bug: #1275771
'}]
commit_message:
nova: use RequestContextSerializer for notifications

RequestContext should be serialized when sent via oslo.messaging. The
serializer is correctly used for the general RPC mechanism, but has been
forgotten in the notifier. This patch fixes that.

Change-Id: I56fa8022e34c0e80835e3bde940fda99ed0f9ba8
Closes-Bug: #1275771

revisions:
[{'number': 4, 'created': '2014-02-05 17:25:34.000000000', 'files': ['ceilometer/service.py'], 'message': 'service: re-enable eventlet just for sockets

This reenables eventlet monkey patching, but just for socket, as that
should be enough to get oslo.rpc unblocked and have the event loop

Fixes-Bug: #127460

commit_message:
service: re-enable eventlet just for sockets

This reenables eventlet monkey patching, but just for socket, as that
should be enough to get oslo.rpc unblocked and have the event loop
running.

Change-Id: I5e9b77a7931ceb69eac458634acdc904e30f0e3d
Fixes-Bug: #127460

revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2014-02-07 11:31:40.000000000', 'files': ['tooz/tests/test_coordination.py'], 'message': 'Adds basic tests which deals with exceptions

The actual tooz tests cover the situations where no exception
is raised. This commit adds some tests that deals with the cases
where a group and/or a member are nonexistent or already exists.
Then it checks that the right exception is raised.

Change-Id: I863cfb0e863aee49376e284f88413a4aefb2ca9e
'}]
commit_message:
Adds basic tests which deals with exceptions

The actual tooz tests cover the situations where no exception
is raised. This commit adds some tests that deals with the cases
where a group and/or a member are nonexistent or already exists.
Then it checks that the right exception is raised.

Change-Id: I863cfb0e863aee49376e284f88413a4aefb2ca9e

revisions:
[{'number': 3, 'created': '2014-02-05 19:11:49.000000000', 'files': ['openstack_dashboard/policy.py'], 'message': "Policy check needs to check for None in target

For objects that don't have a project_id attached to them, the
property can be set to None, which does not get overridden in
the policy engine where it being not set currently does.  This
adds a check for user_id and project_id being None and setting them

Change-Id: I7aeb6d3830a19a7191de9944f8de90ee12dbf127

commit_message:
Policy check needs to check for None in target

For objects that don't have a project_id attached to them, the
property can be set to None, which does not get overridden in
the policy engine where it being not set currently does.  This
adds a check for user_id and project_id being None and setting them
if they are.

Change-Id: I7aeb6d3830a19a7191de9944f8de90ee12dbf127
Closes-bug: #1274053

commit_message:
L3 Agent can handle many external networks

With this patch a l3 agent can handle
any networks by setting the neutron
parameter external_network_bridge
and gateway_external_network_id to
empty.

Related-Bug: #1234750
Related-Bug: #1194350

(cherry picked from commit b5092af696131e611e20f17c6b9aa4f321a854df)

commit_message:
Make Database Interactions More Transactional

Change from manual rollbacks in storage when downstream failures
happen to SQL-like rollbacks. Phase 1 of the Bulk Actions blueprint.

bp/bulk-modify-delete

Change-Id: I40efcccab5e8b813728ba48d47882896e63041df

commit_message:
Fixes TypeError in _leave_group_handler

When catching NoNondeError exception In the _leave_group_handler
function, Missing brackets in string formating of MemberNotJoined
exception message raise a TypeError exception with the message
"TypeError: not enough arguments for format string"

subject: Fix 'Avoid rescuing the Exception class.' warnings
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2014-02-07 00:09:36.000000000', 'files': ['providers/register.rb'], 'message': 'Fix 'Avoid rescuing the Exception class.' warnings

Rubocop warns about doing a rescue on Exception:
"Avoid rescuing the\xa0Exception\xa0class. This will trap signals
and calls to\xa0exit, requiring you to\xa0kill -9the process."

According to the style guide, we should be catching StandardError
instead, which doesn't trap exit signals. This patch addresses that
issue.

Change-Id: I6cf3e6b5cecfdc4d412789d75e1af9e6d53c6e8d
'}]
commit_message:
Fix 'Avoid rescuing the Exception class.' warnings

Rubocop warns about doing a rescue on Exception:
"Avoid rescuing the Exception class. This will trap signals
and calls to exit, requiring you to kill -9the process."

According to the style guide, we should be catching StandardError
instead, which doesn't trap exit signals. This patch addresses that
issue.

Change-Id: I6cf3e6b5cecfdc4d412789d75e1af9e6d53c6e8d

subject: use openrc credentials to verify swift installation
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2014-02-05 17:26:06.000000000', 'files': ['doc/install-guide/object-storage/section_object-storage-verifying-install.xml'], 'message': "use openrc credentials to verify swift installation

Don't use the keystone admin token to authenticate, but a real user
instead (using the openrc.sh config file). This simplifies the swift
commands, and makes the verification more consistent with the
verification of other services.

Change-Id: I6a2512cb6cbb2942c9e8673f3f7d960f2f740e8e
backport: none
(cherry picked from commit 31f384e6260f3bfe8864909537d982f0033c511d)
"}]
commit_message:
use openrc credentials to verify swift installation

Don't use the keystone admin token to authenticate, but a real user
instead (using the openrc.sh config file). This simplifies the swift
commands, and makes the verification more consistent with the
verification of other services.

Change-Id: I6a2512cb6cbb2942c9e8673f3f7d960f2f740e8e
backport: none
(cherry picked from commit 31f384e6260f3bfe8864909537d982f0033c511d)

commit_message:
Move resource_templates to heat.scaling

This introduces a new package for autoscaling code which is
intended for use outside of the Heat engine, and moves the
resource_templates function into a new module, heat.scaling.template.
The function hasn't been changed at all.

Change-Id: I78c420e7a188f2d14780a03b3ea220b9a5fbe86c
Implements: partial blueprint as-lib

reviewers: [{'_account_id': 3, 'name': 'Jenkins', 'username': 'jenkins'}, {'_account_id': 1779, 'name': 'Daniel Berrange', 'email': 'berrange@redhat.com', 'username': 'berrange'}, {'_account_id': 5046, 'name': 'Lance Bragstad', 'email': 'lbragstad@redhat.com', 'username': 'ldbragst'}, {'_account_id': 6873, 'name': 'Matt Riedemann', 'email': 'mriedem.os@gmail.com', 'username': 'mriedem'}, {'_account_id': 8001, 'name': 'John Warren', 'email': 'jswarren@us.ibm.com', 'username': 'jswarren'}, {'_account_id': 8175, 'name': 'Rafael Folco', 'email': 'rfolco@redhat.com', 'username': 'rfolco'}, {'_account_id': 9578, 'name': 'DB Datasets CI', 'email': 'turbo-hipster@lists.rcbops.com', 'username': 'turbo-hipster', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}]
revisions:
[{'number': 12, 'created': '2014-02-06 20:12:09.000000000', 'files': ['nova/tests/virt/libvirt/test_libvirt.py', 'nova/virt/libvirt/driver.py', 'nova/tests/virt/libvirt/fake_libvirt_utils.py'], 'message': "Default video type to 'vga' for PowerKVM

PowerKVM currently doesn't support 'cirrus' video type. For now, we can
detect if Nova compute is running on ppc64 or ppc architecture systems
and set the default to 'vga', which is supported on PowerKVM.

This patch did some reordering of the logic in
nova.virt.libvirt.driver.LibvirtDriver.get_guest_config in an attempt to
set the video.type depending on the compute host architecture and
implementation specifics. The video.type can still be set using
image_meta.

Change-Id: I49a1a8e6d9ebdc28d876d2f958c8cb960892f322
Closes-Bug: 1274367
"}]
commit_message:
Default video type to 'vga' for PowerKVM

PowerKVM currently doesn't support 'cirrus' video type. For now, we can
detect if Nova compute is running on ppc64 or ppc architecture systems
and set the default to 'vga', which is supported on PowerKVM.

This patch did some reordering of the logic in
nova.virt.libvirt.driver.LibvirtDriver.get_guest_config in an attempt to
set the video.type depending on the compute host architecture and
implementation specifics. The video.type can still be set using
image_meta.

Change-Id: I49a1a8e6d9ebdc28d876d2f958c8cb960892f322
Closes-Bug: 1274367

The core of the _create_template logic in autoscaling.py is now in

commit_message:
Refactor _create_template to not rely on instances

The core of the _create_template logic in autoscaling.py is now in
a separate static method, _resource_templates. _resource_templates is
destined to be moved to another scaling module that is intended to
be used outside of the heat engine, so it won't have access to instance
objects.

Implements: partial blueprint as-lib

Change-Id: I0eda024c88534207daa71de2a8eb53738cdd89ef

reviewers: [{'_account_id': 3, 'name': 'Jenkins', 'username': 'jenkins'}, {'_account_id': 4264, 'name': 'Matthias Runge', 'email': 'mrunge@redhat.com', 'username': 'mrunge'}, {'_account_id': 5280, 'name': 'Nicolas Simonds', 'email': 'nic@metacloud.com', 'username': 'nicolas.simonds'}, {'_account_id': 5623, 'name': 'David Lyle', 'email': 'dklyle0@gmail.com', 'username': 'david-lyle'}, {'_account_id': 9622, 'name': 'Cindy Lu', 'email': 'clu@us.ibm.com', 'username': 'clu14'}, {'_account_id': 10007, 'name': 'Tapan Sharma', 'email': 'tapan.sharma@workday.com', 'username': 'taps'}, {'_account_id': 10099, 'name': 'Charles Prince', 'email': 'charles.prince@hp.com', 'username': 'charles-prince'}]
revisions:
[{'number': 3, 'created': '2014-02-05 17:35:55.000000000', 'files': ['openstack_dashboard/dashboards/admin/flavors/workflows.py', 'openstack_dashboard/dashboards/admin/flavors/tests.py'], 'message': 'Don't copy the flavorid when updating flavors

The Nova API makes the implicit assumption that flavorids are unique,
so if one creates two flavors with the same flavorid, subsequent
requests for flavor information can vary between "inaccurate" and
"wildly f*cking inaccurate"

From an end-user perspective, it makes it look like data such as
flavor access settings get lost between edits (because the API pulls
the access list from the wrong flavor)

Let the API assign a new flavorid on changes.  The comments around
the handler code imply that is the desired behaviour, anyhow.

Change-Id: I5403202396a7b136b0ae8637d6aae1cf32550747
Closes-Bug: 1276371
'}]
commit_message:
Don't copy the flavorid when updating flavors

The Nova API makes the implicit assumption that flavorids are unique,
so if one creates two flavors with the same flavorid, subsequent
requests for flavor information can vary between "inaccurate" and
"wildly f*cking inaccurate"

From an end-user perspective, it makes it look like data such as
flavor access settings get lost between edits (because the API pulls
the access list from the wrong flavor)

Let the API assign a new flavorid on changes.  The comments around
the handler code imply that is the desired behaviour, anyhow.

Change-Id: I5403202396a7b136b0ae8637d6aae1cf32550747
Closes-Bug: 1276371

This test checks basic load balancing.

The following is the scenario outline:
  1. Create an instance
  2. SSH to the instance and start two servers
  3. Create a load balancer
  4. Send 10 requests to a floating ip associated with a VIP
     and check that they are shared between the two servers
     and that both of them get equal portions of the requests

bp lbaas-scenario-tests

Change-Id: Ia864a6f532ea58747f04658eb38535ee06a303cb
'}]
commit_message:
Add scenario test for load balancer

This test checks basic load balancing.

The following is the scenario outline:
  1. Create an instance
  2. SSH to the instance and start two servers
  3. Create a load balancer
  4. Send 10 requests to a floating ip associated with a VIP
     and check that they are shared between the two servers
     and that both of them get equal portions of the requests

bp lbaas-scenario-tests

Change-Id: Ia864a6f532ea58747f04658eb38535ee06a303cb

Change the behaviour of the L3 agent in order to set the IP addresses
for the floating IPs on the external gateway interface after the
relevant NAT rules have been applied.
This will avoid a transitory period in which the floating IP exists
and is reachable but it not yet wired to the actual target.

Partial-Bug: #1265505

Change-Id: Ib382fde021868bab2185f2fa5bdee86559148ba7
'}]
commit_message:
Configure floating IPs addresses after NAT rules

Change the behaviour of the L3 agent in order to set the IP addresses
for the floating IPs on the external gateway interface after the
relevant NAT rules have been applied.
This will avoid a transitory period in which the floating IP exists
and is reachable but it not yet wired to the actual target.

Partial-Bug: #1265505

Change-Id: Ib382fde021868bab2185f2fa5bdee86559148ba7

subject: The rescue tests requires neutron resources
revisions:
[{'number': 4, 'created': '2014-02-06 16:32:34.000000000', 'files': ['tempest/api/compute/servers/test_server_rescue.py'], 'message': "The rescue tests requires neutron resources

test_rescued_vm_add_remove_security_group and
the test_rescued_vm_associate_dissociate_floating_ip does not makes
sense if the instance does not have a network connection.

'network' and 'subnet' would be sufficient for the security_group test
case, but the router is required for floating_ip test case.

Closes-Bug: #1274121
Change-Id: Ic8e70d5e549573213b2930d88b5d7da5cd4cf855
"}]
commit_message:
The rescue tests requires neutron resources

test_rescued_vm_add_remove_security_group and
the test_rescued_vm_associate_dissociate_floating_ip does not makes
sense if the instance does not have a network connection.

'network' and 'subnet' would be sufficient for the security_group test
case, but the router is required for floating_ip test case.

Closes-Bug: #1274121
Change-Id: Ic8e70d5e549573213b2930d88b5d7da5cd4cf855

commit_message:
Support not-json error responses

When an error response body isn't a valid json, the content is used as
string.

Change-Id: Id5c9e55e397c1a9f3516090343c1948c87e60ac9
Closes-Bug: #1276638

revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2013-12-12 18:08:58.000000000', 'files': ['nova/db/sqlalchemy/models.py', 'nova/virt/libvirt/driver.py', 'nova/objects/compute_node.py', 'nova/tests/objects/test_compute_node.py', 'nova/scheduler/filters/resource_entitlement_filter.py', 'nova/compute/flavors.py', 'nova/tests/db/test_db_api.py', 'nova/compute/resource_tracker.py', 'nova/scheduler/host_manager.py', 'nova/db/sqlalchemy/migrate_repo/versions/229_add_cpu_entitlement_to_compute_node.py'], 'message': "WIP:Add CPU entitlement support in resource model

While there is support to cpu shares (cpu_weight)
at the driver level, it is not yet modeled
and enforced by the scheduler. This WIP adds
compute_unit_per_vcpu in Flavor's extra_spec,
track the used compute_units in Host Manager
and resource tracker and compare them to the
host's compute_units capacity.

The compute node is assigned with compute_units (e.g. 1000),
Flavor is assigned with compute_unit_per_vcpu (e.g. 250, 500, 1000)

implements: blueprint cpu-entitlement (WIP)

DocImpact

Change-Id: I985a7e6ec5c2d53f821e383f92eeeb9fa30a3771
"}]
commit_message:
WIP:Add CPU entitlement support in resource model

While there is support to cpu shares (cpu_weight)
at the driver level, it is not yet modeled
and enforced by the scheduler. This WIP adds
compute_unit_per_vcpu in Flavor's extra_spec,
track the used compute_units in Host Manager
and resource tracker and compare them to the
host's compute_units capacity.

The compute node is assigned with compute_units (e.g. 1000),
Flavor is assigned with compute_unit_per_vcpu (e.g. 250, 500, 1000)

implements: blueprint cpu-entitlement (WIP)

DocImpact

Change-Id: I985a7e6ec5c2d53f821e383f92eeeb9fa30a3771

commit_message:
Remove vi modelines

We don't need to have the vi modelines in each source file,
it can be set in a user's vimrc if required.
Also a check is added to hacking to detect if they are re-added.

Change-Id: Iaeb9352461165fc19f31177d47a9211b21ed1125
Closes-Bug: #1229324

user's vimrc if required.\nAlso a check is added to hacking to detect if they are re-added.\n\nChange-Id: I903d09557f804c08179bf24bf25295004ad96ca9\nCloses-Bug: #1229324\n"}]
commit_message:
Remove vi modelines

We don't need to have the vi modelines in each source file,
it can be set in a user's vimrc if required.
Also a check is added to hacking to detect if they are re-added.

Change-Id: I903d09557f804c08179bf24bf25295004ad96ca9
Closes-Bug: #1229324

[{'number': 3, 'created': '2014-01-17 13:38:28.000000000', 'files': ['openstack_dashboard/dashboards/admin/flavors/workflows.py', 'openstack_dashboard/dashboards/admin/flavors/tests.py'], 'message': 'Restrict flavor fields input on creation/update.

If flavor properties are invalid, an update message error
is shown, but the flavor get deleted.
The reason is that update flavor is not yet supported so horizon
will delete the flavor and create a new one, failing in the last case.

Fields ram and vcpus need to be >= 1 and eph_gb, swap_mb and disk_gb
>= 0 to create a flavor.

Change-Id: I20d178bad6e4e50c0963acdec72ebedb9bbaba17
Closes-Bug: #1269638
'}]
commit_message:
Restrict flavor fields input on creation/update.

If flavor properties are invalid, an update message error
is shown, but the flavor get deleted.
The reason is that update flavor is not yet supported so horizon
will delete the flavor and create a new one, failing in the last case.

Fields ram and vcpus need to be >= 1 and eph_gb, swap_mb and disk_gb
>= 0 to create a flavor.

Change-Id: I20d178bad6e4e50c0963acdec72ebedb9bbaba17
Closes-Bug: #1269638

commit_message:
Add a Deploymet and a Task in REST API

Controllers for a Task and a Deployment provide CRUD operations. A full
list of supported endpoints and method of v1 (all paths have got
a prefix /v1):

GET     /deployments
POST    /deployments
GET     /deployments/{deploy_id}
DELETE  /deployments/{deploy_id}
POST    /deployments/{deploy_id}/recreate
GET     /deployments/engines
GET     /deployments/providers

GET     /tasks
POST    /tasks
GET     /tasks/{task_id}
DELETE  /task/{task_id}?force=true
GET     /task/{task_id}/results

Also, rally.objects.{Task,Deployment} support iterations, 'get_all'
method that returns a list of objects. A Task have got a 'get_results'
method. Some orchestration API methods return an objects as a result.

TODO: A proper exception handling.

blueprint rally-service-api-v1

Change-Id: Ied632fd21aae305a0f1f67dea7a4401f9652bf9e

commit_message:
Implement grizzly to havana upgrade for network

Uninstall quantum packages, stop quantum service based
on attributes defined. Need to remove the dashboard conf file
if an all-in-one install because the dashboard packages
are removed automatically.

Change-Id: I40b343322f782420ebfd016bd9bd67248dc20e79
Implements: openstack-upgrade

subject: VMware: Update block_device_info in test_spawn_attach_volume_vmdk
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2014-01-23 11:55:41.000000000', 'files': ['nova/tests/virt/vmwareapi/test_driver_api.py'], 'message': "VMware: Update block_device_info in test_spawn_attach_volume_vmdk

We can avoid mocking block_device_info_get_mapping if we pass
block_device_mapping to spawn as part of block_device_info.

This change also moves 'mount_device' to block_device_mapping from
block_device_info, adds 'root_device_name' to block_device_info, and
prepends /dev/ to both of these paths. All of these changes reflect
how the data is actually passed in.

Change-Id: I17ff3cc2fdf231206834c34cadeee870cc69a1ee
"}]
commit_message:
VMware: Update block_device_info in test_spawn_attach_volume_vmdk

We can avoid mocking block_device_info_get_mapping if we pass
block_device_mapping to spawn as part of block_device_info.

This change also moves 'mount_device' to block_device_mapping from
block_device_info, adds 'root_device_name' to block_device_info, and
prepends /dev/ to both of these paths. All of these changes reflect
how the data is actually passed in.

Change-Id: I17ff3cc2fdf231206834c34cadeee870cc69a1ee

commit_message:
Remove security_group related quota from v3 API

Remove 'security_group_rules' and 'security_groups' from usages
for v3 API, that should be access to neutron directly.
Get 'key_pair' usage for user and remove it for project since
it is user basis resource.

Change-Id: I3eb83eeb950f3b1b4696113ecce88f5b35fdc022
Closes-bug: #1240361

revisions:
[{'number': 5, 'created': '2014-01-21 10:59:11.000000000', 'files': ['trove/tests/unittests/guestagent/test_dbmodels.py', 'trove/guestagent/db/models.py'], 'message': "Corrects host-validation for mysql-user

Reasons:
- The validation applied in _is_valid_host_name are:
  1. If host-name is None or it is '%'.
  2. Test for a valid IP with for if CONF.hostname_require_ipv4,
- Problem is, if a non-ip based host-name had a string with '%'
  like '%.com' it would fail the validation.
- While putting the condition to check '%' in host-name, there is still
  a need to eliminate consecutive % in name.

Changes:
- Changes the host-validation for non-ip hostname.
- Changes the host-name condition to check that if hostname has '%',
  but not consecutively to stop invalid entries like 'a%%.com'.

Change-Id: I249e4c23296df9c16dc23e0c5573c749c7ba10d7
Closes-Bug: #1199197
"}]
commit_message:
Corrects host-validation for mysql-user

Reasons:
- The validation applied in _is_valid_host_name are:
  1. If host-name is None or it is '%'.
  2. Test for a valid IP with for if CONF.hostname_require_ipv4,
- Problem is, if a non-ip based host-name had a string with '%'
  like '%.com' it would fail the validation.
- While putting the condition to check '%' in host-name, there is still
  a need to eliminate consecutive % in name.

Changes:
- Changes the host-validation for non-ip hostname.
- Changes the host-name condition to check that if hostname has '%',
  but not consecutively to stop invalid entries like 'a%%.com'.

Change-Id: I249e4c23296df9c16dc23e0c5573c749c7ba10d7
Closes-Bug: #1199197

commit_message:
Mark task as running before performing action.

Marking the task as running before calling the run method on the action makes sure that the task status is set running while a synchronous action executes.

Change-Id: Ida74384ac5cc910bd4e66ebf8591ed2599150304
Closes-Bug: #1274384

subject: WIP: cache compute_node_get_all in scheduler host_manager
reviewers: [{'_account_id': 3, 'name': 'Jenkins', 'username': 'jenkins'}, {'_account_id': 1501, 'name': 'Phil Day', 'email': 'philip.day@hp.com', 'username': 'philip-day'}, {'_account_id': 1849, 'name': 'Joe Gordon', 'email': 'joe.gordon0@gmail.com', 'username': 'jogo'}, {'_account_id': 4912, 'name': 'Michael H Wilson', 'email': 'geekinutah@gmail.com', 'username': 'geekinutah'}, {'_account_id': 7494, 'name': 'Guangya Liu', 'email': 'gyliu513@gmail.com', 'username': 'JayLau'}, {'_account_id': 7629, 'name': 'Shawn Hartsock', 'email': 'hartsock@acm.org', 'username': 'hartsocks'}]
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2013-11-18 22:23:13.000000000', 'files': ['nova/openstack/common/memorycache.py', 'nova/scheduler/host_manager.py'], 'message': "WIP: cache compute_node_get_all in scheduler host_manager

This is a first draft, just to show the idea.

We already have the concept that the DB isn't the exact state of the world,
right now it's updated every 10 seconds. And we use the scheduler retry
mechanism to handle cases where the scheduler was wrong. This patch
extends the idea that the scheduler may have an outdated state of the
world and caches DB calls for a configurable mount of time.

This helps reduce the number of DB calls made by the scheduler at the
cost of scheduler accuracy. To maintain backwards compatibility caching
will be turned off by default.

Note: oslo's memorycache  module was changed because if the cache is very
large iterating over all keys can take a while. This will be broken out into separate patch.

Change-Id: I76dc193020a9316d4e4c3580ed9815e83f4411bf
"}]
commit_message:
WIP: cache compute_node_get_all in scheduler host_manager

This is a first draft, just to show the idea.

We already have the concept that the DB isn't the exact state of the world,
right now it's updated every 10 seconds. And we use the scheduler retry
mechanism to handle cases where the scheduler was wrong. This patch
extends the idea that the scheduler may have an outdated state of the
world and caches DB calls for a configurable mount of time.

This helps reduce the number of DB calls made by the scheduler at the
cost of scheduler accuracy. To maintain backwards compatibility caching
will be turned off by default.

Note: oslo's memorycache  module was changed because if the cache is very
large iterating over all keys can take a while. This will be broken out into separate patch.

Change-Id: I76dc193020a9316d4e4c3580ed9815e83f4411bf

commit_message:
Add trusts to Solum

This patch adds keystone trusts to Solum.
Trusts can be used to call API methods
of OpenStack services without user's
authentication token.

Change-Id: Ic6b566fb116c38f908e11441d1f3dd054fa84828
Implements: blueprint auth-trusts

revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2014-02-05 22:40:16.000000000', 'files': ['openstack_dashboard/dashboards/admin/projects/tables.py', 'openstack_dashboard/dashboards/admin/projects/workflows.py'], 'message': "Restrict the length of the project name input

There is an allowed maximum length for project name field, but in
current code, it doesn't check or restrict that from UI side, i.e. user
will be able to type in more than what is allowed. After form
submission, it will fail but there is no clear message telling user what
caused failure.

After adding the code to restrict the max length of the project name

Closes-Bug: #1276389
"}]
commit_message:
Restrict the length of the project name input

There is an allowed maximum length for project name field, but in
current code, it doesn't check or restrict that from UI side, i.e. user
will be able to type in more than what is allowed. After form
submission, it will fail but there is no clear message telling user what
caused failure.

After adding the code to restrict the max length of the project name
field, user will not be able to input more than what is allowed, thus
this error will be prevented from UI.

Change-Id: I6e61387c1e89e47e16354719870047c6e4760989
Closes-Bug: #1276389

commit_message:
Remove default_notification_level from conf

This config option is used when you use the notify_wrapper wrapper
function from openstack.common. As we don't use the wrapper we don't
ever require the config option so we shouldn't show it to users.

blueprint oslo-messaging

Change-Id: I95280af37a84c71131fb2fc92c9302b8926c95bd

commit_message:
Depending on python-swiftclient>=1.6

Now we're depending on python-swiftclient>=1.6 since the parameter
'headers' was introduced since python-swiftclient 1.6. This is a
regression issue introduced by patch:
https://review.openstack.org/#/c/48913/

get_object(container, obj, resp_chunk_size=None, query_string=None,
response_dict=None, headers=None)

Closes-Bug: #1276033

Change-Id: I174f2dc53a402d48301b17839be8b5fa97064805

commit_message:
Expose image property 'owner' in v2 API

The 'owner' property on an image is exposed in v1 but does
not appear in the v2 image response. It would be useful to
have this available.

docImpact
Implement blueprint expose-owner-in-v2

Change-Id: I90f68d57e185f4a5ee63cd97bd5597948dde33ea

commit_message:
Handle API 500 response in OS::Nova::Server

novaclient raises a ClientException when a 500 response code is returned
from the Nova API.  Previously, this would cause the stack action to
fail.  Log a warning instead.

Closes-Bug: #1276517
Change-Id: I8f00d476c8d7166aca74fdcd3e0f2621c00d9802

[{'number': 7, 'created': '2014-02-05 09:50:23.000000000', 'files': ['etc/keystone.conf.sample', 'keystone/tests/test_wsgi.py', 'keystone/common/config.py', 'bin/keystone-all', 'keystone/common/environment/eventlet_server.py'], 'message': 'Adds tcp_keepalive and tcp_keepidle config options

Currently the wsgi server will not close connections once requests
complete and will not enable keepalive on it's wsgi sockets. This can
be a problem for those who need to align the server keepalive with
load balancer timeouts without modifying system keepalive settings.

To remedy this we add new config options tcp_keepalive and
tcp_keepidle which are disabled by default to remain backwards
compatible.

'}]
commit_message:
Adds tcp_keepalive and tcp_keepidle config options

Currently the wsgi server will not close connections once requests
complete and will not enable keepalive on it's wsgi sockets. This can
be a problem for those who need to align the server keepalive with
load balancer timeouts without modifying system keepalive settings.

To remedy this we add new config options tcp_keepalive and
tcp_keepidle which are disabled by default to remain backwards
compatible.

DocImpact: "new config options for wsgi tcp_keepalive & tcp_keepidle"
Closes-bug: bug 1260406
Co-authored-by: Hirofumi Ichihara <ichihara.hirofumi@lab.ntt.co.jp>
Change-Id: Ic53402c57e1ebe44cde4c18e5e15200dcbbcb04b

commit_message:
Create Authentication Plugins

Provides the framework for creating authentication plugins and using
them from a session object.

To allow this system to co-exist with the original client there is a bit
of a hack. The client object itself is now also an authentication
plugin, that supports the original client pattern. If a client is
created without a session object then that session object uses the
client as it's authentication plugin.

Change-Id: I682c8dcd3705148aaa804a91f4ed48a5b74bdc12
blueprint: auth-plugins

revisions:
[{'number': 9, 'created': '2014-02-03 03:43:35.000000000', 'files': ['keystoneclient/tests/test_session.py', 'keystoneclient/discover.py', 'keystoneclient/client.py', 'keystoneclient/httpclient.py', 'keystoneclient/session.py'], 'message': 'Provide a conversion function for creating session

Session.construct will create a session based upon the kwargs that used
to be passed to a client __init__ function. This will allow clients an
easy path to providing compatibility with deprecated arguments.

Make use of the function throughout discovery. Discovery was initially
released prior to the session object being completed and was therefore
handled with the same arguments as a client. Instead we should use a
session object so use the conversion function to convert those kwargs
into a session object if one is not provided.

Change-Id: I8dc1e0810ea6ebc6ea648ec37d7881825c566676
'}]
commit_message:
Provide a conversion function for creating session

Session.construct will create a session based upon the kwargs that used
to be passed to a client __init__ function. This will allow clients an
easy path to providing compatibility with deprecated arguments.

Make use of the function throughout discovery. Discovery was initially
released prior to the session object being completed and was therefore
handled with the same arguments as a client. Instead we should use a
session object so use the conversion function to convert those kwargs
into a session object if one is not provided.

Change-Id: I8dc1e0810ea6ebc6ea648ec37d7881825c566676

commit_message:
Resource for querying available language packs

We want the ability to specify the language pack that should be used
to build a DU. For this, we need the ability to query the language
packs that are currently available. Defined a resource to query
available language packs. The resource is defined at
(/v1/language_packs).

This code is based on the new API worker architecture

Partly implements: blueprint specify-lang-pack

Change-Id: I32fbfe2388f1e571d8ddcce001b6752d08747e1e

[{'number': 7, 'created': '2014-02-06 04:25:20.000000000', 'files': ['nova/tests/compute/test_compute_mgr.py', 'nova/compute/manager.py'], 'message': "Don't try to restore VM's in state ERROR.

We don't try to restore VM's that are in a failed BUILDING state, so
attempting to start ERROR VMs is more than a little weird. The one
exception to this rule are VMs that are in RESIZE_MIGRATING, since
recovery is already attempted. It's also a problem, because many ERROR
states aren't recoverable from (at the moment anyhow).

Closes-Bug: #1272623
Change-Id: I0599b83a82ad3ee67a92126d3b57df5b02e20539
Co-Authored-By: Robert Collins <rbtcollins@hp.com>
"}]
commit_message:
Don't try to restore VM's in state ERROR.

We don't try to restore VM's that are in a failed BUILDING state, so
attempting to start ERROR VMs is more than a little weird. The one
exception to this rule are VMs that are in RESIZE_MIGRATING, since
recovery is already attempted. It's also a problem, because many ERROR
states aren't recoverable from (at the moment anyhow).

Closes-Bug: #1272623
Change-Id: I0599b83a82ad3ee67a92126d3b57df5b02e20539
Co-Authored-By: Robert Collins <rbtcollins@hp.com>

subject: Add tests for swift-ring-builder
revisions:
[{'number': 6, 'created': '2014-02-05 16:20:34.000000000', 'files': ['swift/cli/ringbuilder.py', 'test/unit/cli/test_ringbuilder.py', 'setup.cfg'], 'message': 'Add tests for swift-ring-builder

Add some tests for essential methods in swift-ring-builder.
Tests for removing or changing device settings are executed
with different search values to cover many possible command
line arguments.

Currently tested methods:

- create ring
- add device
- remove device
- set weight
- set info
- set min_part_hours
- set replicas

Tests use swift.common.ring.RingBuilder to verify actions.

Catching and testing output from print statements is not
tested, because this requires redirecting sys.stdout during
tests and that might have some sideeffects for testing tools.

bin/swift-ring-builder has been moved to swift/cli/ringbuilder.py
and slightly modified to work as before (mainly due to no more
existing global variables since that part of the code has been
moved inside a main() function).

Change-Id: Ia63f59a8faca1fad990784f27532ca07a2125454
'}]
commit_message:
Add tests for swift-ring-builder

Add some tests for essential methods in swift-ring-builder.
Tests for removing or changing device settings are executed
with different search values to cover many possible command
line arguments.

Currently tested methods:

- create ring
- add device
- remove device
- set weight
- set info
- set min_part_hours
- set replicas

Tests use swift.common.ring.RingBuilder to verify actions.

Catching and testing output from print statements is not
tested, because this requires redirecting sys.stdout during
tests and that might have some sideeffects for testing tools.

bin/swift-ring-builder has been moved to swift/cli/ringbuilder.py
and slightly modified to work as before (mainly due to no more
existing global variables since that part of the code has been
moved inside a main() function).

Change-Id: Ia63f59a8faca1fad990784f27532ca07a2125454

commit_message:
Reorganize docker-plugin for consistency

Package and Module names shouldn't have dashes in them, since it makes
it harder to import them (i.e. one cannot use ``import dashed-module``).

Also, moving docker resource under resources for consistency.

Partial-Bug: #1271226
Change-Id: I785b626a99516ebe6444296cf62a78dd96355060

commit_message:
Restructure Rackspace resources

During doc generation, resources have their own templates and need
to be separate from non-resource modules.  This removes the ``heat``
``engine`` and ``plugins`` folders and moves all resources into a
``resources`` folder, effectively separating the custom Rackspace
Client from custom Rackspace resources.

Partial-Bug: #1271226
Change-Id: Idbdc8400d30e2e745a2dc1b2d2fa1b7cff50d57b

commit_message:
Don't use shred for volume_clear=zero

We should just call copy_volume unless volume_clear='shred' is
specified.

commit_message:
Replace Policy Index with Policy Name in Response Headers

The policy index is intended for internal use only so response
headers should always use the name, not the index.

Change-Id: I9395e99994fd412d40877340419f90b08b911dd4
Implements: blueprint storage-policies

subject: heat_keystoneclient add support for stack domain projects
revisions:
[{'number': 3, 'created': '2014-02-05 15:59:31.000000000', 'files': ['etc/heat/heat.conf.sample', 'heat/common/heat_keystoneclient.py', 'heat/tests/test_heatclient.py', 'heat/common/config.py'], 'message': 'heat_keystoneclient add support for stack domain projects

Adds support for creating projects inside the heat stack domain.

A new project will be created in the stack domain if the stack creates
any InstanceUser resource, and the "stack domain project" will then
encapsulate all users associated with resources in the stack.

Adds a new stack_user_domain option which will be used to specify the
name of the domain where heat will create the projects/users.

Change-Id: I7bb1830489baf5fb6761d7e1c914dc3ab0450181
blueprint: instance-users
'}]
commit_message:
heat_keystoneclient add support for stack domain projects

Adds support for creating projects inside the heat stack domain.

A new project will be created in the stack domain if the stack creates
any InstanceUser resource, and the "stack domain project" will then
encapsulate all users associated with resources in the stack.

Adds a new stack_user_domain option which will be used to specify the
name of the domain where heat will create the projects/users.

Change-Id: I7bb1830489baf5fb6761d7e1c914dc3ab0450181
blueprint: instance-users

subject: Add time_type dictionary to test_migrations
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2014-01-06 22:49:17.000000000', 'files': ['cinder/tests/test_migrations.py'], 'message': 'Add time_type dictionary to test_migrations

A number of postgresql migration tests fail because the test case
is verifying that an sqlalchemy.types.DATETIME column was created.
When the column type is checked, however, postgresql reports the type as
sqlalchemy.types.TIMESTAMP.  The mismatch causes numerous
test cases to fail for postgresql.

This creates a dictionary for each engine being tested to handle the
different time types.

Change-Id: Ic9921ff9fda001a66c0ea3a6a75c8adefa60b107
Closes-bug: 1262426
'}]
commit_message:
Add time_type dictionary to test_migrations

A number of postgresql migration tests fail because the test case
is verifying that an sqlalchemy.types.DATETIME column was created.
When the column type is checked, however, postgresql reports the type as
sqlalchemy.types.TIMESTAMP.  The mismatch causes numerous
test cases to fail for postgresql.

This creates a dictionary for each engine being tested to handle the
different time types.

Change-Id: Ic9921ff9fda001a66c0ea3a6a75c8adefa60b107
Closes-bug: 1262426

commit_message:
Empty file shouldn't contain copyright nor license

According to policy change in HACKING:
http://docs.openstack.org/developer/hacking/#openstack-licensing
empty files should no longer contain copyright notices.

Change-Id: If51c1fe7b28c1b9976429fcbea28bd4953dd41bf
Closes-Bug: #1262424

In order to successfully run sphinxcontrib-spelling on Ceilometer docs we need
to replace all non-ascii symbols with the analogous ones from ascii.

Without this fix sphinxcontrib-spelling will fail with:
"UnicodeEncodeError: 'ascii' codec can't encode character u'\u2019'

commit_message:
Replace non-ascii symbols in docs

In order to successfully run sphinxcontrib-spelling on Ceilometer docs we need
to replace all non-ascii symbols with the analogous ones from ascii.

Without this fix sphinxcontrib-spelling will fail with:
"UnicodeEncodeError: 'ascii' codec can't encode character u'\u2019'
in position 8: ordinal not in range(128)"

Change-Id: I37891b9471571c3509aece3949d9593738f99849

outputs the file size instead of the internal VHD size.

Closes-bug #1275805

commit_message:
Add tests for handlers

Handlers should be tested independently of controllers. I added
tests for current handlers.

Controller tests should mock the 'handler' part and test
controller code only. I have not modified any controller tests
due to the many pending patchs on the db that changes tests, in
order to avoid conflicts.

However, I will create a bug not to forget to improve controller
later

Change-Id: I0080c9456fd39af75bcac7642e1a225189bef59b

commit_message:
Removes cmd_rd_client in scripts/redstack

Reasons:
- The ancient mode of retrieving token is no more a fashion.
- Trove client which gives direct access to trove commands,
- More help for accessing troveclient is at,
https://github.com/openstack/python-troveclient/blob/master/README.rst

Change-Id: Ia46c9a46e09ffbccac1a9f3e62ce311682736f03
Closes-Bug: #1272183

reviewers: [{'_account_id': 3, 'name': 'Jenkins', 'username': 'jenkins'}, {'_account_id': 4715, 'name': 'Angus Salkeld', 'email': 'asalkeld@redhat.com', 'username': 'asalkeld'}, {'_account_id': 8334, 'name': 'Noorul Islam K M', 'email': 'noorul@noorul.com', 'username': 'noorul'}, {'_account_id': 8443, 'name': 'Georgy Okrokvertskhov', 'email': 'gokrokvertskhov@mirantis.com', 'username': 'gokrokvertskhov'}, {'_account_id': 9094, 'name': 'Paul Montgomery', 'email': 'PaulMontgomery.code@gmail.com', 'username': 'paulmo'}]
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2014-02-06 22:47:37.000000000', 'files': ['solum/tests/fakes.py'], 'message': "Quick fix for TypeError on FakePecanRequest

Some patches currently in review have the following error
TypeError: 'FakePecanRequest' object does not support item assignment
The error happens when we try to set a custom content-type
https://review.openstack.org/#/c/70168/
https://review.openstack.org/#/c/69855/

It can potentially break other coming patches

I fixed this bug in another review https://review.openstack.org/#/c/70975/
but it should not be in branches with dependent patches and get in master
the earliest.

Change-Id: I74aa9edb264c7ce8990752796d69e5faef30accb
"}]
commit_message:
Quick fix for TypeError on FakePecanRequest

Some patches currently in review have the following error
TypeError: 'FakePecanRequest' object does not support item assignment
The error happens when we try to set a custom content-type
https://review.openstack.org/#/c/70168/
https://review.openstack.org/#/c/69855/

It can potentially break other coming patches

I fixed this bug in another review https://review.openstack.org/#/c/70975/
but it should not be in branches with dependent patches and get in master
the earliest.

Change-Id: I74aa9edb264c7ce8990752796d69e5faef30accb

commit_message:
adding configuration group support

This allows users to make custom configurations groups and apply them to
multiple instances. Configuration parameters that can be set are listed
in the validation_rules.json file.

implements blueprint configuration-management

Change-Id: I99b0bfe51c131ace30774e75e30d620101ed2e0b

commit_message:
Support Neutron security groups in scenario testing

The methods
NetworkScenarioTest._create_security_group()
and
NetworkScenarioTest.create_loginable_secgroup_rule()
use the nova client by default.

Added helper functions "*_neutron" that use the neutron (network)
client.
Moved old implementation into "*_nova" for old usage.

Adds methods to scenario/manager to allow for generic creation of
neutron secgroup and rules as existing methods only create a secgroup
with login rules (incoming ping and ssh).

Partial-Bug: #1277040
Change-Id: I6de4bf9f7deed215cf61c87c3ae3f4240982523e
(cherry picked from commit eb69f3fc9e245e8a59845976861947c695bec314)

commit_message:
fix DeletableSubnet in api/network/common

DeletableSubnet._router_ids was defined as a static attribute, causing
errors on tearDown working with multiple {router,subnet} couples as it
tries to disconnect subnet from all routers existing instead of all
routers connected to it

Partial-Bug: #1277040
Change-Id: Id446d7bb2be117ea56b52e6a644b259089cdc158
(cherry picked from commit ca1d9a9523b9d6615a8db9f785144e22adb8c81b)

Also adds workaround for bug 1247568 in python-neutronclient (preventing

commit_message:
scenario cross_tenant_connectivity

test conectivity between VMs in the same tenant and on different
tenants.
for each case, test that default state blocks traffic(*), that security
rules allow only specified traffic

(*)negative connectivity check is skipped until bug 1252620 is fixed
   TODO(yfried): enable them once bug is fixed

Also adds workaround for bug 1247568 in python-neutronclient (preventing
tearDownClass from ignoring deleted neutron resources

Partial-Bug: #1277040
Change-Id: I212873d46e20ff3161e376105af18020b1cf1c9d
(cherry picked from commit 4d7efa6d030bca335c7fb9f45e53650ef2ceb562)

subject: Fix log and test for NeutronAPI.update_port_dhcp_opts
revisions:
[{'number': 3, 'created': '2014-02-05 17:38:36.000000000', 'files': ['ironic/tests/test_neutron.py', 'ironic/common/neutron.py'], 'message': 'Fix log and test for NeutronAPI.update_port_dhcp_opts

The unit tets for NeutronAPI.update_port_dhcp_opts were raising the
wrong exception, and would pass regardless of the behaviour of
update_port_dhcp_opts.

This patch causes the mock to raise a neutron_client exception and
correctly asserts that ironic.common.neutron.NeutronAPI converts the
neutron client expcetion to an ironic exception.

It also adjusts the LOG behavior of this method to properly record
the exception traceback, which could be useful in determining the
failure in the neutron client.

Change-Id: I6f231b6a823386709b5778d140d6aa48ae4997ce
'}]
commit_message:
Fix log and test for NeutronAPI.update_port_dhcp_opts

The unit tets for NeutronAPI.update_port_dhcp_opts were raising the
wrong exception, and would pass regardless of the behaviour of
update_port_dhcp_opts.

This patch causes the mock to raise a neutron_client exception and
correctly asserts that ironic.common.neutron.NeutronAPI converts the
neutron client expcetion to an ironic exception.

It also adjusts the LOG behavior of this method to properly record
the exception traceback, which could be useful in determining the
failure in the neutron client.

Change-Id: I6f231b6a823386709b5778d140d6aa48ae4997ce

commit_message:
Make nova-compute-{kvm,qemu} packages overridable

To keep the "we define platform choices in the attributes" spirit, the
nova-compute "support packages" for ubuntu should be overridable, too.

This change makes them behave just like  to the
"#{db_type}_python_packages" in openstack-compute::nova-common.

Change-Id: Id38169121e52e0dc8be808c8822db55069e65e48

[{'number': 1, 'created': '2014-02-06 19:30:29.000000000', 'files': ['keystoneclient/common/cms.py'], 'message': 'Check for any monkeypatching

Checking oinly for monkeypatching of the ``os`` module is
insufficient.  A process might have chosen not to patch ``os`` but
still needs to use the eventlet version of Popen to deal with proper
forks.  This version checks if any modules have been monkeypatched
with the eventlet versions.

Closes-Bug: #1277231

Change-Id: Ia8d7150e9e7ced58132e8e90e7ad68fb3c7c3b9f
'}]
commit_message:
Check for any monkeypatching

Checking oinly for monkeypatching of the ``os`` module is
insufficient.  A process might have chosen not to patch ``os`` but
still needs to use the eventlet version of Popen to deal with proper
forks.  This version checks if any modules have been monkeypatched
with the eventlet versions.

Closes-Bug: #1277231

Change-Id: Ia8d7150e9e7ced58132e8e90e7ad68fb3c7c3b9f

subject: Add filter option to stack-list
revisions:
[{'number': 3, 'created': '2014-02-05 20:40:37.000000000', 'files': ['heatclient/tests/test_shell.py', 'heatclient/v1/stacks.py', 'heatclient/tests/test_utils.py', 'heatclient/common/utils.py', 'heatclient/v1/shell.py'], 'message': 'Add filter option to stack-list

Add ability to use filters on stack-list by passing a ``--filters``
options to the command line.  This option can appear multiple times or
be used once with several key=value filters separated by semicolons.  If
the same key appears more than once, both will be taken into account
when sending the request to the API.

e.g.:
The option:
``--filters status=COMPLETE;status=FAILED``
Will issue the call:
 ``/stacks?status=COMPLETE&status=FAILED``

Closes-Bug: 1268816
Change-Id: I553d6b5e3ceebdb24dcd4e4c8e409a4375d72333
'}]
commit_message:
Add filter option to stack-list

Add ability to use filters on stack-list by passing a ``--filters``
options to the command line.  This option can appear multiple times or
be used once with several key=value filters separated by semicolons.  If
the same key appears more than once, both will be taken into account
when sending the request to the API.

e.g.:
The option:
``--filters status=COMPLETE;status=FAILED``
Will issue the call:
 ``/stacks?status=COMPLETE&status=FAILED``

Closes-Bug: 1268816

commit_message:
Add pagination (limit and marker) to stack-list

Add support for ``limit`` and ``marker`` on stack-list and remove
unnecessary ``page_size`` parameter.

When using ``limit`` and/or ``marker``, stack-list will keep previous
behavior and list all stacks starting from ``marker`` up to ``limit``,
even if limit exceeds API limit restrictions, by using multiple calls
to /stacks endpoint.

Partial-Bug: 1268816
Change-Id: Ifb08c1aadd3629d60ddc56ffc507c99b9dba80ce

subject: Fix issue with mysql not restarting on new bind_ip
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2014-02-06 14:56:34.000000000', 'files': ['recipes/mysql-server.rb', 'spec/mysql-server_spec.rb'], 'message': "Fix issue with mysql not restarting on new bind_ip

Addresses: bug #1277041

By default mysql binds to 127.0.0.1. Setting the bind_ip attribute to
something else, as we do in the ops-database cookbook before calling the
mysql::server recipe, causes the my.cnf to be populated with the correct IP.

However, because of this bug in the upstream mysql cookbook:
https://tickets.opscode.com/browse/COOK-4161
mysql does not get restarted (it only gets reloaded)
and so the new bind_ip does not take effect.

This commit adds a workaround until the upstream bug is fixed. The
workaround directly modifies the template resource from the resource
collection to add a 'restart mysql' notification.

Change-Id: I4f59e9f7fecb5040532948d0bb07d49385280a48
"}]
commit_message:
Fix issue with mysql not restarting on new bind_ip

Addresses: bug #1277041

By default mysql binds to 127.0.0.1. Setting the bind_ip attribute to
something else, as we do in the ops-database cookbook before calling the
mysql::server recipe, causes the my.cnf to be populated with the correct IP.

However, because of this bug in the upstream mysql cookbook:
https://tickets.opscode.com/browse/COOK-4161
mysql does not get restarted (it only gets reloaded)
and so the new bind_ip does not take effect.

This commit adds a workaround until the upstream bug is fixed. The
workaround directly modifies the template resource from the resource
collection to add a 'restart mysql' notification.

Change-Id: I4f59e9f7fecb5040532948d0bb07d49385280a48

revisions:
[{'number': 6, 'created': '2014-02-05 11:19:00.000000000', 'files': ['spec/server_spec.rb', 'templates/default/neutron.conf.erb'], 'message': 'Explicitly set rpc_backend to kombu when using rabbitmq

On centos systems, /usr/share/neutron/neutron-dist.conf sets:

rpc_backend = neutron.openstack.common.rpc.impl_qpid

In order to set this correctly when using rabbit, we need to explicitly
set it in neutron.conf to override the setting in the dist file

- explicitly set rpc_backend when rabbitmq used
- add wrap around commented out zmq section

Change-Id: Ifea0ecc7ec50f7a0938b1bdd19f9da73dcb42c1e
Implements: blueprint centos-rhel-for-network
'}]
commit_message:
Explicitly set rpc_backend to kombu when using rabbitmq

On centos systems, /usr/share/neutron/neutron-dist.conf sets:

rpc_backend = neutron.openstack.common.rpc.impl_qpid

In order to set this correctly when using rabbit, we need to explicitly
set it in neutron.conf to override the setting in the dist file

- explicitly set rpc_backend when rabbitmq used
- add wrap around commented out zmq section

Change-Id: Ifea0ecc7ec50f7a0938b1bdd19f9da73dcb42c1e
Implements: blueprint centos-rhel-for-network

subject: Stop sourcing devtest_undercloud.
revisions:
[{'number': 7, 'created': '2014-02-06 21:52:23.000000000', 'files': ['scripts/devtest_undercloud.sh', 'scripts/devtest_setup.sh', 'scripts/devtest.sh', 'undercloudrc'], 'message': 'Stop sourcing devtest_undercloud.

Like devtest_seed, we need endpoint details and noproxy settings as
outputs from the undercloud script. By moving them into the structured
testenvironment file we can query them later without depending on an
ever moving set of environment variables. This will also support using
pre-running underclouds to run overcloud tests in CI (when we get to
that).

Change-Id: Ida6beac05c46ab5c7da8a77ae3a14fec5a39a825
'}]
commit_message:
Stop sourcing devtest_undercloud.

Like devtest_seed, we need endpoint details and noproxy settings as
outputs from the undercloud script. By moving them into the structured
testenvironment file we can query them later without depending on an
ever moving set of environment variables. This will also support using
pre-running underclouds to run overcloud tests in CI (when we get to
that).

Change-Id: Ida6beac05c46ab5c7da8a77ae3a14fec5a39a825

commit_message:
Fix init of pci_stats in resource tracker

Because pci_stats is list of dict, i.e., [{}, {}, ...],
if pci_stats is null, its field should be '[]' not '{}'.

When making object models, we found this bug in PCI stuffs.

Related to blueprint pci-extra-info.

Change-Id: I06564cb541b050060e87fd3d334299df66f23dec

revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2014-01-31 13:50:06.000000000', 'files': ['tox.ini'], 'message': 'Enable hacking H233 rule

H233: Python 3.x incompatible use of print operator

Python 3 support is a good feature for OpenStack service client,
and we already have a patch for H233 but still ignore it in hacking check,
we can enable it to avoid introducing such problem again.

Change-Id: I5295ef62eef7a9f6ec7f2b67d6b68dbe2dec7067
ref: https://review.openstack.org/#/c/52841/
'}]
commit_message:
Enable hacking H233 rule

H233: Python 3.x incompatible use of print operator

Python 3 support is a good feature for OpenStack service client,
and we already have a patch for H233 but still ignore it in hacking check,
we can enable it to avoid introducing such problem again.

Change-Id: I5295ef62eef7a9f6ec7f2b67d6b68dbe2dec7067
ref: https://review.openstack.org/#/c/52841/

commit_message:
Add ENV vars to set default and all interface roles forward

Add FORWARD_DEFAULT, MGMT_FORWARD, PRIVATE_FORWARD and STORAGE_FORWARD
 to test settings. If FORWARD_DEFAULT is defined it will become the
 default value for {ADMIN,PUBLIC,MGMT,PRIVATE,STORAGE}_FORWARD
 parameters. In it's absence the defaults are.

 ADMIN_FORWARD nat
 PUBLIC_FORWARD nat
 MGMT_FORWARD None (isolated)
 PRIVATE_FORWARD None (isolated)
 STORAGE_FORWARD None (isolated)

Closes-bug: #1275859

Change-Id: I0e5ebbb3269b02e6477323c53f6114086a225000

commit_message:
Fix un-changeable resource in l3_if_downup

The previous patch attempted to change @resource[:wait_carrier_after_ifup]
 this dosn't work. This patch changes this to create a new variable to test
 before entering into the carrier wait loop

Change-Id: I1f6e8d8eff253dc665a66bf64f1d2ecfedb1f63a
Related-bug: #1275132

commit_message:
Return correct HTTP response codes for create ops

When creating {chassis,node,port} resources the incorrect HTTP
response code was being returned. (was 200, now returning 201).

Closes-Bug: #1272596

subject: Update Debian to use /etc/network/interfaces.d
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2014-01-29 18:16:13.000000000', 'files': ['elements/dhcp-all-interfaces/install.d/dhcp-all-interfaces.sh'], 'message': 'Update Debian to use /etc/network/interfaces.d

Updates the dhcp-all-interfaces.sh script so that we use
interfaces.d for ENI files. This change is useful for
several reasons:

 1) we need the ability to overwrite the DHCP config file for a
  specific interface when it is moved onto an OVS bridge.  This
  is important for our TripleO neutron initialization changes in
  this branch where we will use a similar approach:

    https://review.openstack.org/#/c/69918/

 2) it makes it possible to disable an interface that is unplugged

Change-Id: I537b4df1c7a2431bacebe6e4aa7576d17d17a16f
'}]
commit_message:
Update Debian to use /etc/network/interfaces.d

Updates the dhcp-all-interfaces.sh script so that we use
interfaces.d for ENI files. This change is useful for
several reasons:

 1) we need the ability to overwrite the DHCP config file for a
  specific interface when it is moved onto an OVS bridge.  This
  is important for our TripleO neutron initialization changes in
  this branch where we will use a similar approach:

    https://review.openstack.org/#/c/69918/

 2) it makes it possible to disable an interface that is unplugged

Change-Id: I537b4df1c7a2431bacebe6e4aa7576d17d17a16f

commit_message:
Removes logging of location uri

This patch removes logging of sensitive store location uri, which
is logged when an exception occurs while trying to get the object
from the store or due to a failure in getting the store api due to
unauthorized context.

fixes bug 1275062

Change-Id: I679baa0897f242f4b8372c9c1c7ab28ae811f5e5

commit_message:
Add a new chapter for upgrades

This chapter is probably the most-requested document in
all of OpenStack. Let's see if we can do it.

* pre-upgrade testing
* steps to upgrade Compute and Networking grizzly-->havana

Do not merge until testing is done.

Change-Id: Ic27b98c30dec278746c22f434e32ed677247f8a9

commit_message:
Add vagrantfile/environment for a working vagrant all-in-one using
nova-network

Implements: blueprint reference-havana-vagrant

- remove unused attrs from previous example vagrant.rb, and change to
  vagrant-aio-nova.json
- add Vagrantfile-aio-nova targeted specifically at an allinone using
  nova-network (other vagrantfiles can cover other deployments)
- Update CentOS box to 6.5
- Remove Vagrantfile and environments/vagrant.rb to avoid confusion
- allow multiple simultaneous vagrant up with different chef-zero
  servers
- add usage comments at top of file

Change-Id: I9e4145dd1f22efa7e423794bb122bde756884f40

subject: Better socket termination for ZeroMQ
revisions:
[{'number': 11, 'created': '2013-07-23 17:38:29.000000000', 'files': ['tests/unit/rpc/test_zmq.py', 'openstack/common/rpc/impl_zmq.py'], 'message': 'Better socket termination for ZeroMQ

Sending and closing ZeroMQ sockets only
block on access to the file descriptor,
not on the sending of data or the closing
of sockets.

As such, the timeout in _cast() was ineffective and
resulted in immediately calling close().

Because close() defaults to linger=-1, the underlying
file descriptor (managed by a ZeroMQ thread spawned
within the C library) would only be closed
upon the successful sending of the message.

This would result in a file descriptor leak and
infinite attempts to deliver messages despite
the timeout per message sent to a non-existant consumer.

The solution is to use the linger
argument to expire the messages if they cannot
be delivered within the timeout window.

This patch also removes the eventlet spawn in
_multi_send as it was unnecessary and caused a
race-condition discovered by the new test. Now,
calling cast() will block on the completion of
_cast() -- ensuring messages are locally enqueued
before returning. (It does NOT block on the delivery
of a message)

Adds a tests to test_zmq that assures messages cast
to a topic cannot be consumed after the expiration
of the cast timeout and, to complete coverage, of
the new code, that messages may generally be
consumed following a message cast.

Fixes bug 1193439

Change-Id: I07c7996ee76873ee762582e58dbbec05bc7de66c
'}]
commit_message:
Better socket termination for ZeroMQ

Sending and closing ZeroMQ sockets only
block on access to the file descriptor,
not on the sending of data or the closing
of sockets.

As such, the timeout in _cast() was ineffective and
resulted in immediately calling close().

Because close() defaults to linger=-1, the underlying
file descriptor (managed by a ZeroMQ thread spawned
within the C library) would only be closed
upon the successful sending of the message.

This would result in a file descriptor leak and
infinite attempts to deliver messages despite
the timeout per message sent to a non-existant consumer.

The solution is to use the linger
argument to expire the messages if they cannot
be delivered within the timeout window.

This patch also removes the eventlet spawn in
_multi_send as it was unnecessary and caused a
race-condition discovered by the new test. Now,
calling cast() will block on the completion of
_cast() -- ensuring messages are locally enqueued
before returning. (It does NOT block on the delivery
of a message)

Adds a tests to test_zmq that assures messages cast
to a topic cannot be consumed after the expiration
of the cast timeout and, to complete coverage, of
the new code, that messages may generally be
consumed following a message cast.

Fixes bug 1193439

Change-Id: I07c7996ee76873ee762582e58dbbec05bc7de66c

subject: New module to import into httpd for speedup
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2014-02-03 21:30:12.000000000', 'files': ['keystone/httpd/import_this.py', 'keystone/httpd/__init__.py', 'httpd/keystone.py'], 'message': "New module to import into httpd for speedup

Apache httpd has a configuration option to pre-import modules
(WSGIImportScript). If WSGIImportScript isn't used, then the
modules aren't loaded until the first request comes in, so that
first request will take longer due to the overhead of parsing the
modules.

The httpd scripts that we provided weren't appropriate for importing
because it did too much, specifically it would configure() every
time.

This change introduces a script keystone/httpd/import_this.py that
can be used with WSGIImportScript like so:

 WSGIImportScript /opt/stack/keystone/keystone/httpd/import_this.py
     process-group=keystone application-group=%{GLOBAL}

This is optional, if this option isn't set in the httpd configuration
the scripts run as normal.

Change-Id: I83a587307f18948811c34a54891bea0ec169791d
"}]
commit_message:
New module to import into httpd for speedup

Apache httpd has a configuration option to pre-import modules
(WSGIImportScript). If WSGIImportScript isn't used, then the
modules aren't loaded until the first request comes in, so that
first request will take longer due to the overhead of parsing the
modules.

The httpd scripts that we provided weren't appropriate for importing
because it did too much, specifically it would configure() every
time.

This change introduces a script keystone/httpd/import_this.py that
can be used with WSGIImportScript like so:

 WSGIImportScript /opt/stack/keystone/keystone/httpd/import_this.py
     process-group=keystone application-group=%{GLOBAL}

This is optional, if this option isn't set in the httpd configuration
the scripts run as normal.

Change-Id: I83a587307f18948811c34a54891bea0ec169791d

commit_message:
Make context available during constraint validation

This makes context optionally available in properties and during
constraint validation, to be able to add more advanced constraints which
make API calls.

blueprint param-constraints

subject: Mock sys.exit in testing
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2014-02-06 02:43:12.000000000', 'files': ['keystone/tests/core.py', 'keystone/service.py', 'keystone/tests/test_utils.py'], 'message': 'Mock sys.exit in testing

If exit is called during subunit then it exits the subunit process which
makes the test suite fail with no information.

Closes-Bug: #1276885

commit_message:
Mock sys.exit in testing

If exit is called during subunit then it exits the subunit process which
makes the test suite fail with no information.

Change-Id: I7c189fad05f0d38c35e4014ff414d91841bc7632
Closes-Bug: #1276885

commit_message:
Return single unicode type from exception messages

Instead of returning mixed str vs unicode types from
the exception_message function just return a single
type (unicode) and try different variations of encodings
to achieve the final unicode string.

Change-Id: I7ecd882a36a226f3c1dc3447a6930ae49b347637
