revisions:
[{'number': 18, 'created': '2014-01-29 21:20:14.000000000', 'files': ['neutron/tests/unit/test_db_plugin.py', 'neutron/db/db_base_plugin_v2.py', 'neutron/db/models_v2.py', 'neutron/tests/unit/nicira/test_networkgw.py'], 'message': "Simplify ip allocation/recycling to relieve db pressure

I found that multiple calls to delete_port can pile up on the
_recycle_ip operation.  This patch simplifies this operation.  It
reduces the _recycle_ip operation to a single row delete in the ip
allocations table and doesn't touch the availability table.

To acheive the recycling of ips in a pool, this code runs a more
complex operation of rebuilding the availability table when it is
exhausted.  Only one API process will perform this more expensive
operation and others waiting for allocation will immediately benefit.
The amortized cost of this operation is much less than the cumulative
cost of running the more expensive _recycle_ip operation for every
port delete.

IP allocation behaves a bit differently with this patch.  Instead of
giving out the first IP available in a pool, the entire pool will be
allocated before wrapping around and recycling ip addresses that have
been released.  This is a desirable feature as it puts ip addresses in
a sort of quarantine after they are released.  It is easier to
distinguish newly allocated ips from old ones.

Change-Id: Ia55b66128de9986e075b0f87acc401d211cd91d3
Closes-Bug: #1252506
Closes-Bug: #1257815
"}]
commit_message:
Simplify ip allocation/recycling to relieve db pressure

I found that multiple calls to delete_port can pile up on the
_recycle_ip operation.  This patch simplifies this operation.  It
reduces the _recycle_ip operation to a single row delete in the ip
allocations table and doesn't touch the availability table.

To acheive the recycling of ips in a pool, this code runs a more
complex operation of rebuilding the availability table when it is
exhausted.  Only one API process will perform this more expensive
operation and others waiting for allocation will immediately benefit.
The amortized cost of this operation is much less than the cumulative
cost of running the more expensive _recycle_ip operation for every
port delete.

IP allocation behaves a bit differently with this patch.  Instead of
giving out the first IP available in a pool, the entire pool will be
allocated before wrapping around and recycling ip addresses that have
been released.  This is a desirable feature as it puts ip addresses in
a sort of quarantine after they are released.  It is easier to
distinguish newly allocated ips from old ones.

Change-Id: Ia55b66128de9986e075b0f87acc401d211cd91d3
Closes-Bug: #1252506
Closes-Bug: #1257815

subject: Allow environment to not have resource_registry
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2014-02-05 21:04:01.000000000', 'files': ['heatclient/tests/test_template_utils.py', 'heatclient/common/template_utils.py'], 'message': 'Allow environment to not have resource_registry

If you try to use an environment file that contains only parameters,
or even nothing, you get a NoneType error as the client is expecting
there to be a value in the resource_registry section. This stops that
error, thus allowing environment files to be empty or just contain
parameters.

Change-Id: I0c6c3bb60182915df346ebf8dd4e98ccc652ffb1
Closes-Bug: #1273881
'}]
commit_message:
Allow environment to not have resource_registry

If you try to use an environment file that contains only parameters,
or even nothing, you get a NoneType error as the client is expecting
there to be a value in the resource_registry section. This stops that
error, thus allowing environment files to be empty or just contain
parameters.

Change-Id: I0c6c3bb60182915df346ebf8dd4e98ccc652ffb1
Closes-Bug: #1273881

revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2013-12-24 12:24:08.000000000', 'files': ['neutron/plugins/ml2/drivers/l2pop/mech_driver.py', 'neutron/tests/unit/ml2/drivers/test_l2population.py', 'neutron/plugins/ml2/drivers/l2pop/db.py'], 'message': '[ML2] l2-pop MD handle multi create/delete ports

If more than one port is added or removed simultaneously, port db entry
have status BUILD or DOWN and pass to ACTIVE when agent have finish to
configured it.
l2-pop mechanism driver use events port pass to ACTIVE or DOWN to send
fdb entries. In case of port is the first or the last network port on
an agent, the flooding entry need to be add or removed.

This patch fix the method to determine how many ports are active on a
agent by adding filter on status port to be ACTIVE.

Closes-bug: #1263881
Change-Id: I9c1f8bd69dee37bc01a5d42327aa5f737998c5aa
'}]
commit_message:
[ML2] l2-pop MD handle multi create/delete ports

If more than one port is added or removed simultaneously, port db entry
have status BUILD or DOWN and pass to ACTIVE when agent have finish to
configured it.
l2-pop mechanism driver use events port pass to ACTIVE or DOWN to send
fdb entries. In case of port is the first or the last network port on
an agent, the flooding entry need to be add or removed.

This patch fix the method to determine how many ports are active on a
agent by adding filter on status port to be ACTIVE.

Closes-bug: #1263881
Change-Id: I9c1f8bd69dee37bc01a5d42327aa5f737998c5aa

commit_message:
Tweak version nvp/nsx version validation logic for router operations

This patch improves how the nsx/nvp controller version is validated
prior to some router operations. This is done by greatly simplifying
the boolean condition.

Missing unit tests are also added for increased coverage.

Closes-bug: 1274361

Change-Id: I1b21444fd86b6e6a0c72bb5a43f1707934dd70e4

commit_message:
Fix a bug in v3 API doc

This patch changes the wrong variable names 'addFixedIp' and 'networkId',
which were not used in V3 multinic API. We use 'add_fixed_ip' and
'network_id' in V3 multinic API.

Closes-bug: #1265716

Change-Id: I0c91764603d941df6d011a3b1266eb354c0bc54f

subject: Fix bittorrent URL configuration option
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2014-02-05 19:21:06.000000000', 'files': ['nova/virt/xenapi/image/bittorrent.py', 'nova/tests/virt/xenapi/image/test_bittorrent.py'], 'message': 'Fix bittorrent URL configuration option

This change modifies bittorrent to give URL setting preference to the
configuration option first and then to entry point addins.  The thought
process is that users will want the ability to change the URL
via configuration.  The entry point is code and slower to address.

If the user really wants to use the entry point, they can leave
the configuration option empty.

Existing test cases updated to reflect new priority.

Change-Id: I5af94b4b50531fc7801e70d83b89dd7ed2bcf310
'}]
commit_message:
Fix bittorrent URL configuration option

This change modifies bittorrent to give URL setting preference to the
configuration option first and then to entry point addins.  The thought
process is that users will want the ability to change the URL
via configuration.  The entry point is code and slower to address.

If the user really wants to use the entry point, they can leave
the configuration option empty.

Existing test cases updated to reflect new priority.

Change-Id: I5af94b4b50531fc7801e70d83b89dd7ed2bcf310

commit_message:
API schema for v3 console_output API

By defining the API schema, it is possible to separate the validation
code from the API method. The API method can be more simple.
In addition, a response of API validation error can be consistent for
the whole Nova API.

Partially implements blueprint nova-api-validation-fw

Change-Id: Id6330e2250448c54679df4f27af25c2614a871f0

commit_message:
Fix exception handling miss in remote_consoles.

The ConsoleTypeUnavailable exception raised in
nova/virt/libvirt/driver.py is not handled, and will make
nova api and compute fail.
This patch fixes this bug.

Closes-bug: #1270076

Change-Id: I6ff7a40bf26dbef4bd5512a9c3c4a8664a664244

commit_message:
Ignore 'dynamic' addr flag on bridge configuration

When setting the bridge up, if that flag is present but not
ignored, the delete command will fail and may leave the
interface and the bridge in an inconsistent state.

Closes-Bug: #1274611
Related-Bug: #1077066
Change-Id: Iff65d61d724d0de5d8173ac37f7f748aa23e5d8b

subject: ip_address_show should not raise exception
revisions:
[{'number': 5, 'created': '2014-02-06 11:23:30.000000000', 'files': ['fuelweb_test/tests/tests_strength/test_failover.py', 'fuelweb_test/models/fuel_web_client.py'], 'message': "ip_address_show should not raise exception

* The FuelWebClient.ip_address_show raised error if 'ip address show'
command returns nothing (return 1). But caller expects string. So
if ip command returns 1 the method should return empty string.
* Add additional parameter to the method to make it more universal.
The parameter is pipe string / commands and it is possible to grep
within the method

Change-Id: Ibf14c54c4439d8403a1058f0991363e18362ca35
"}]
commit_message:
ip_address_show should not raise exception

* The FuelWebClient.ip_address_show raised error if 'ip address show'
command returns nothing (return 1). But caller expects string. So
if ip command returns 1 the method should return empty string.
* Add additional parameter to the method to make it more universal.
The parameter is pipe string / commands and it is possible to grep
within the method

Change-Id: Ibf14c54c4439d8403a1058f0991363e18362ca35

commit_message:
Make .expiring_objects account name configurable

The account which tracks objects scheduled for deletion had its name
hard-coded to 'expiring_objects'. This is made configurable via
expiring_objects_account_name option. Backend file-systems
integration efforts may want to treat these "special" accounts in a
different way.

This would still go undocumented, hence 'pseudo-hidden'.

UpgradeImpact: None as the default value would continue to be the same
               which is '.expiring_objects'.

Change-Id: I1a093b0d0e2bdd0c3d723090af03fc0adf2ad7e3
Signed-off-by: Prashanth Pai <ppai@redhat.com>

subject: Fix deadlock on waiting for pending_writers to be empty
revisions:
[{'number': 6, 'created': '2014-02-06 02:17:26.000000000', 'files': ['taskflow/utils/lock_utils.py', 'taskflow/tests/unit/test_utils_lock_utils.py'], 'message': 'Fix deadlock on waiting for pending_writers to be empty

Deadlock can occur when a reader X waits for pending writers
to be empty but the reader X already owns a read lock (since
it will then wait for pending writers to be empty which it
will never be, since pending writers is only empty when
there are no readers - but since the current thread X is getting
another read lock it result in deadlock for the reader and
deadlock for the writer).

Closes-Bug: #1276868

Change-Id: Ibe13eafa4bd0bc817e8bfe3cf303c54298778b37
'}]
commit_message:
Fix deadlock on waiting for pending_writers to be empty

Deadlock can occur when a reader X waits for pending writers
to be empty but the reader X already owns a read lock (since
it will then wait for pending writers to be empty which it
will never be, since pending writers is only empty when
there are no readers - but since the current thread X is getting
another read lock it result in deadlock for the reader and
deadlock for the writer).

Closes-Bug: #1276868

Change-Id: Ibe13eafa4bd0bc817e8bfe3cf303c54298778b37

subject: Add serializer capability to fake_notifier.
revisions:
[{'number': 3, 'created': '2014-02-05 17:45:35.000000000', 'files': ['nova/tests/fake_notifier.py'], 'message': 'Add serializer capability to fake_notifier.

With the change to oslo.messaging.notify.Notifier, we have
introduced the serializer plugin.  In some implementations
this is used to modify the notfications/serialize data.  The
implementations will want to test their serializers and
the easiest way to do this is via the fake_notifier.
This change allows fake_notifier to act more like
notifier with serializer being a pass in as an argument.

The serializer is passed to subnotifiers created via
the prepare method.

Change-Id: I03ef9ed92366961d4e296381d149c54d7da97f70
'}]
commit_message:
Add serializer capability to fake_notifier.

With the change to oslo.messaging.notify.Notifier, we have
introduced the serializer plugin.  In some implementations
this is used to modify the notfications/serialize data.  The
implementations will want to test their serializers and
the easiest way to do this is via the fake_notifier.
This change allows fake_notifier to act more like
notifier with serializer being a pass in as an argument.

The serializer is passed to subnotifiers created via
the prepare method.

Change-Id: I03ef9ed92366961d4e296381d149c54d7da97f70

Having the sphinx theme in the same namespace package
as the production code has been causing issues with
devstack installations. This change renames the package
to move it out of the namespace. Another change to the
openstack-infra/config repository will rename the

Change-Id: I7788a9d6b5984fdfcc4678f2182104d2eb8a2be0

commit_message:
Rename package from oslo.sphinx to oslosphinx

Having the sphinx theme in the same namespace package
as the production code has been causing issues with
devstack installations. This change renames the package
to move it out of the namespace. Another change to the
openstack-infra/config repository will rename the
git repository and associated jobs.

Partial-bug: #1277168

Change-Id: I7788a9d6b5984fdfcc4678f2182104d2eb8a2be0

calls instead of going direct to the database.

Related to blueprint nova-network-objects

No need to loop over with pkill -f

I guess four times is better than one but if we need four times to kill
swift processes there is something pretty bad with it.

revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2014-02-06 10:41:09.000000000', 'files': ['setup.cfg'], 'message': "Honor install prefix

No need to put 'usr/' in front of data files, distros have the default
prefix set to '/usr' already such that 'setup.py install' does the right
thing. Compare with the results of 'python setup.py bdist'.

Change-Id: I8d7f592abece22f8bb70deede776509cdd1446e5
"}]
commit_message:
Honor install prefix

No need to put 'usr/' in front of data files, distros have the default
prefix set to '/usr' already such that 'setup.py install' does the right
thing. Compare with the results of 'python setup.py bdist'.

Change-Id: I8d7f592abece22f8bb70deede776509cdd1446e5

subject: Tests initialize database
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2014-01-29 03:50:57.000000000', 'files': ['keystone/tests/core.py', 'keystone/identity/backends/sql.py', 'keystone/tests/test_backend_sql.py'], 'message': "Tests initialize database

Many tests (for example the backend_kvs tests) failed to run
individually. This is because the tests made the assumption that
because the system is configured for the KVS (or non-SQL) backend
that the database isn't required. The problem with this assumption
is that different backends can use different storage mechanisms,
and the credential backend only supports SQL. So any test that
requires that backends are loaded is required to initialize the
database.

Change-Id: I109b83bf512598952346bef01dc33c57802c7f60
"}]
commit_message:
Tests initialize database

Many tests (for example the backend_kvs tests) failed to run
individually. This is because the tests made the assumption that
because the system is configured for the KVS (or non-SQL) backend
that the database isn't required. The problem with this assumption
is that different backends can use different storage mechanisms,
and the credential backend only supports SQL. So any test that
requires that backends are loaded is required to initialize the
database.

Change-Id: I109b83bf512598952346bef01dc33c57802c7f60

A glance-manage db upgrade/db downgrade will do either an 'upgrade to
latest' or 'downgrade to None' even though a version argument is
provided. The version being passed isn't being picked up and None is
passed across.

Fixes bug 1258068
Change-Id: Iaab4cf5eeb6d7c9c94fc741841a6b0797a058d40
"}]
commit_message:
glance-manage wont take version into consideration

A glance-manage db upgrade/db downgrade will do either an 'upgrade to
latest' or 'downgrade to None' even though a version argument is
provided. The version being passed isn't being picked up and None is
passed across.

Fixes bug 1258068
Change-Id: Iaab4cf5eeb6d7c9c94fc741841a6b0797a058d40

subject: Fix policy.py
revisions:
[{'number': 3, 'created': '2014-02-05 13:48:54.000000000', 'files': ['etc/manila/policy.json', 'manila/policy.py', 'manila/share/api.py', 'manila/api/v1/security_service.py', 'manila/tests/test_share_api.py'], 'message': "Fix policy.py

Because inside check_policy() there is hardcoded
'share' target prepended to all policies, any
policy we check will be checked against 'share'
policy. Change check_policy() to use explicit
target and action instead of just action.
Change wrap_check_policy decorator to be a
decorator maker which accepts resource name
as an argument.
Closes-Bug: #1274951
Partial-Bug: #1271943

Change-Id: I85c184035619d78107d56ea94918f608d8d7c282
"}]
commit_message:
Fix policy.py

Because inside check_policy() there is hardcoded
'share' target prepended to all policies, any
policy we check will be checked against 'share'
policy. Change check_policy() to use explicit
target and action instead of just action.
Change wrap_check_policy decorator to be a
decorator maker which accepts resource name
as an argument.
Closes-Bug: #1274951
Partial-Bug: #1271943

Change-Id: I85c184035619d78107d56ea94918f608d8d7c282

commit_message:
Squash all migrations into one

Migration #12 have fixed bug
https://bugs.launchpad.net/manila/+bug/1272303,
but introduced a new one. Because that bug
was rather architectural, we need to address
that architectural flaw instead of fixing
bugs as they come.
Closes-Bug: #1275044

Change-Id: I260a90abd1107c62b687118d5d4a01d7199ea56f

[{'number': 2, 'created': '2014-01-29 06:03:23.000000000', 'files': ['tests/unit/db/sqlalchemy/test_utils.py', 'openstack/common/db/sqlalchemy/session.py'], 'message': "Fix parsing of UC errors in sqlite 3.7.16+/3.8.2+

The new version of libsqlite changed the format of error messages.
Code of oslo.db helpers must be updated appropriately. This was meant
to be fixed by I86e9673ac409b3b3e881bea7cb8b3516f320388d, but that

commit_message:
Fix parsing of UC errors in sqlite 3.7.16+/3.8.2+

The new version of libsqlite changed the format of error messages.
Code of oslo.db helpers must be updated appropriately. This was meant
to be fixed by I86e9673ac409b3b3e881bea7cb8b3516f320388d, but that
change doesn't cope well with the new format of column names.

Closes-Bug: #1259915

Change-Id: Iec39c8804ea47307a98d1b79899ff74af9404bf6

commit_message:
Make _change_index_columns use existing utility methods

The _change_index_columns method is doing a drop/add index operation and
since we have utility methods to do exactly that already, just re-use
them.

Change-Id: I5706c4512b1324aab64f70cd053c464d9a50e233

commit_message:
Add the plan objects and schema

In the interest of simplicity the plan gets stored as a Text blob.
We could change this in the future to split it out into a composite
object.

commit_message:
Add API resources for Plans and Plan

Plans are used as a template for creating assemblies. This patch adds a
place to hang documentation for Plan and Plans resources.

Also see: https://etherpad.openstack.org/p/solum-demystified

blueprint api
Change-Id: I56240f79ddbd49d69b9e62b7b2030863eeadf3c5
Co-Authored-By: Angus Salkeld <angus.salkeld@rackspace.com>

commit_message:
Clean swap_volume rollback, on libvirt exception.

Handling swap_volume command's rollback on the manager side
instead of the API, to allow clean rollback.

Change-Id: I7d5c1e66bf01fd12fcaa783c1c3c90d92b009aea
Closes-Bug: #1222656

commit_message:
Fix TCP/UDP usage for rsyslog logging

- Introduce 'both' value for rsyslog server proto
- Make rsyslog server to listen both tcp and udp
- Fix wrong proto param usage for clients (clients
  should use $rservers hash instead)
- Change base rsyslog server proto to TCP

CI retest
Additional to: #1271176
Closes bug: #1276065

Change-Id: I3b13781a85a88dcb7d36edb54f5ad60c2f16c74b
Signed-off-by: Bogdan Dobrelya <bdobrelia@mirantis.com>

In order to collect HA logs locally as well to syslog,
use either corosync logfile option or custom rsyslog
template, but not both.

commit_message:
Enable corosync log to pacemaker.log locally

In order to collect HA logs locally as well to syslog,
use either corosync logfile option or custom rsyslog
template, but not both.

This patch enables custom rsyslog template for
pacemaker.log to avoid messages duplicating in daemon.log.

Closes bug: #1275127

Change-Id: I237414f38c312243ad51e5d14f6c6141b684f956
Signed-off-by: Bogdan Dobrelya <bdobrelia@mirantis.com>

subject: Fix string-to-boolean casting in queries
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2014-02-05 13:16:41.000000000', 'files': ['ceilometer/tests/api/v2/test_list_meters_scenarios.py', 'ceilometer/api/controllers/v2.py'], 'message': "Fix string-to-boolean casting in queries

There is a function that converts strings to boolean that uses the
following rule:
Strings-True ('1', 't', 'true', 'on', 'y', 'yes') are converted to True
Strings-False ('0', 'f', 'false', 'off', 'n', 'no') are converted to False

But there is a default value (False by default) that returned in case when
the string is not in any of lists above. So by default any string that is
not in Strings-True will be converted to False. We may change this behaviour
by using strict=True checking.

If user creates a query we should validate that only valid strings (as above)
or boolean True or False are used in case of boolean filter.

Relates to bug 1236496

Change-Id: I83a54f09d715269c2d356bb7979a0372e6f7d2d0
"}]
commit_message:
Fix string-to-boolean casting in queries

There is a function that converts strings to boolean that uses the
following rule:
Strings-True ('1', 't', 'true', 'on', 'y', 'yes') are converted to True
Strings-False ('0', 'f', 'false', 'off', 'n', 'no') are converted to False

But there is a default value (False by default) that returned in case when
the string is not in any of lists above. So by default any string that is
not in Strings-True will be converted to False. We may change this behaviour
by using strict=True checking.

If user creates a query we should validate that only valid strings (as above)
or boolean True or False are used in case of boolean filter.

Relates to bug 1236496

Change-Id: I83a54f09d715269c2d356bb7979a0372e6f7d2d0

commit_message:
LBaaS: fix handling pending create/update members and health monitors

When agent requests loadbalancer logical config from server,
server returns only active pool members and health_monitors.
Need to make server return also members and monitors which are in pending states.

Also a small refactoring moving ACTIVE_PENDING set to common place

Change-Id: I8e10004f199f982b055da18ea7a0e5e4d11fa7fb
Closes-Bug: #1259965

commit_message:
Revert "Shelve: The snapshot should be removed when delete instance."

This reverts commit 48729259c570d73d7c35228718ecc4e9bb258e36.

The fingerprint for bug 1275256 started showing up around 1/28/14
and there are a lot of rechecks around that shelve-related patch
so it's probably the cause of the race condition.

Closes-Bug: #1275256

Change-Id: I76373af0e09555b99399127c1ad10346cce77f45

subject: Remove unnecessary volume creation in test_server_rescue
revisions:
[{'number': 9, 'created': '2014-02-05 02:14:42.000000000', 'files': ['tempest/api/compute/base.py', 'tempest/api/compute/servers/test_server_rescue.py', 'tempest/api/compute/v3/servers/test_server_rescue.py'], 'message': "Remove unnecessary volume creation in test_server_rescue

The setup in test_server_rescue is creating two volumes where really
only one shared volume is necessary, so remove the second volume. This
patch also uses the common base class code to wait for the volume
deletion on tear down and makes the volume name random within the
context of the class name for easier debugging.

This patch moves the volume create/delete into the specific test cases
that need them, uses the common base class code to delete the volume and
wait for it to be gone, and also moves the _delete_volume method from
the v2 compute base test class into it's parent so the v3 compute base
test case can also use it with it's own volumes client.

Partial-Bug: #1254772

Change-Id: Id98f65cc2843a97221222e86c60b3859e15af869
"}]
commit_message:
Remove unnecessary volume creation in test_server_rescue

The setup in test_server_rescue is creating two volumes where really
only one shared volume is necessary, so remove the second volume. This
patch also uses the common base class code to wait for the volume
deletion on tear down and makes the volume name random within the
context of the class name for easier debugging.

This patch moves the volume create/delete into the specific test cases
that need them, uses the common base class code to delete the volume and
wait for it to be gone, and also moves the _delete_volume method from
the v2 compute base test class into it's parent so the v3 compute base
test case can also use it with it's own volumes client.

Partial-Bug: #1254772

Change-Id: Id98f65cc2843a97221222e86c60b3859e15af869

commit_message:
Expunge session contents between plugin requests

In the NVP plugin, metadata processing performs several plugin operations
with the same context (and db session). The first operation might leave
persisted objects in the session instance which then conflict with objects
created in the second operation.

Closes-Bug: #1266482

Change-Id: Ic9e2b952013610647aa222f1a8b6e33504b54b37

According to the documentation [1] and for consistency, notifications
sent by Heat for stack CRUD operations must be :
orchestration.stack.{create,update,delete,suspend,resume}.{start,error,end}

Currently the notifications sent looks like (missing 'stack.')
orchestration.{create,update,delete,suspend,resume}.{start,error,end}

Fixes bug #1273240

Change-Id: Id46158c495f10436b62755deaf5b6a91e2e7e4bc
"}]
commit_message:
Fix event_type names for stack CRUD notifications

According to the documentation [1] and for consistency, notifications
sent by Heat for stack CRUD operations must be :
orchestration.stack.{create,update,delete,suspend,resume}.{start,error,end}

Currently the notifications sent looks like (missing 'stack.')
orchestration.{create,update,delete,suspend,resume}.{start,error,end}

[1] https://wiki.openstack.org/wiki/SystemUsageData

Fixes bug #1273240

Change-Id: Id46158c495f10436b62755deaf5b6a91e2e7e4bc

This simple resource allows cloud-config to be specified
as a map property, and stores the resulting YAML as a SoftwareConfig
resource.

Because cloud-init is boot only, this resource won't be used with
a SoftwareDeployment resource, also it will not have inputs or outputs.

Instead, a server's user_data can contain this resource via get_resource

"}]
commit_message:
A cloud-config resource based on SoftwareConfig

This simple resource allows cloud-config to be specified
as a map property, and stores the resulting YAML as a SoftwareConfig
resource.

Because cloud-init is boot only, this resource won't be used with
a SoftwareDeployment resource, also it will not have inputs or outputs.

Instead, a server's user_data can contain this resource via get_resource
when user_data_format is SOFTWARE_CONFIG.

Implements: blueprint cloud-init-resource

Change-Id: I15c8d6a03b8da274531b76cca658e37def4eb460

subject: Ensure stack lock is released after stack-delete
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2014-02-05 21:51:27.000000000', 'files': ['heat/tests/test_engine_service.py', 'heat/engine/stack_lock.py', 'heat/engine/service.py'], 'message': 'Ensure stack lock is released after stack-delete

Previously, stack locks would not be released after a stack-delete
because the stack ID was being passed to db_api.stack_lock_release() as
None.  To resolve this, pass the stack ID to the greenthread-linked
release function while it still exists.

Change-Id: I260c4c5512bd2069f134e9d6ac6ea07565e443b0
Closes-Bug: #1276336
'}]
commit_message:
Ensure stack lock is released after stack-delete

Previously, stack locks would not be released after a stack-delete
because the stack ID was being passed to db_api.stack_lock_release() as
None.  To resolve this, pass the stack ID to the greenthread-linked
release function while it still exists.

Change-Id: I260c4c5512bd2069f134e9d6ac6ea07565e443b0
Closes-Bug: #1276336

subject: Verify setenforce is executable
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2014-02-04 16:21:24.000000000', 'files': ['heat/cloudinit/boothook.sh'], 'message': 'Verify setenforce is executable

Some images/distros do not install/use selinux. This small change will
verify that `setenforce` is executable and in the path before attempting
to run the command. This prevents the script from erroring and causing a
failed `cloud-init` run.

Change-Id: I42f802c7994b8d907f0cc4e3b1a38e6fd89dac0c
'}]
commit_message:
Verify setenforce is executable

Some images/distros do not install/use selinux. This small change will
verify that `setenforce` is executable and in the path before attempting
to run the command. This prevents the script from erroring and causing a
failed `cloud-init` run.

reviewers: [{'_account_id': 3, 'name': 'Jenkins', 'username': 'jenkins'}, {'_account_id': 7, 'name': 'Jay Pipes', 'email': 'jaypipes@gmail.com', 'username': 'jaypipes'}, {'_account_id': 1192, 'name': 'David Kranz', 'email': 'dkranz@redhat.com', 'username': 'david-kranz'}, {'_account_id': 4694, 'name': 'Miguel Lavalle', 'email': 'miguel@mlavalle.com', 'username': 'minsel'}, {'_account_id': 5803, 'name': 'Attila Fazekas', 'email': 'afazekas@redhat.com', 'username': 'afazekas'}, {'_account_id': 7872, 'name': 'Marc Koderer', 'email': 'marc@koderer.com', 'username': 'mkoderer'}, {'_account_id': 9008, 'name': 'VMware NSX CI', 'username': 'vmwareminesweeper', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}]
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2014-01-23 06:13:32.000000000', 'files': ['tempest/api/network/test_vpnaas_extensions.py'], 'message': 'Call super class after extension check in vpnaas api test

This commit fixes a bug in test_vpnaas_extensions.py. If the extension
is disabled then the tenant isolation code is called generating a new
tenant and the resources needed to use it in this test. However, since
the skip exception is raised after the super() call the tearDownClass
will not be run. This will cause the resources created by tenant
isolation to never get deleted. This commit fixes this behavior by
moving the skip before the super call.

Change-Id: Id7915978e7a42f641ff99493cb3918424dd98674
Closes-Bug: #1268852
'}]
commit_message:
Call super class after extension check in vpnaas api test

This commit fixes a bug in test_vpnaas_extensions.py. If the extension
is disabled then the tenant isolation code is called generating a new
tenant and the resources needed to use it in this test. However, since
the skip exception is raised after the super() call the tearDownClass
will not be run. This will cause the resources created by tenant
isolation to never get deleted. This commit fixes this behavior by
moving the skip before the super call.

Change-Id: Id7915978e7a42f641ff99493cb3918424dd98674
Closes-Bug: #1268852

revisions:
[{'number': 4, 'created': '2014-01-27 13:42:00.000000000', 'files': ['nova/virt/vmwareapi/vmops.py', 'nova/virt/vmwareapi/vm_util.py', 'nova/tests/virt/vmwareapi/test_vm_util.py'], 'message': 'VMware: fix image snapshot with attached volume

A snapshot of a instance with an attached volume will result in
the wrong volume being uploaded to glance. The reason for this
are as follows:
1. the last image in the list of images would be exported
2. the base image would not be exported but the first found

The same happens with a VM rescue if there is a cinder volume
attached.

The solution is to search for an image that contains the instance
UUID.

Change-Id: Ic85b0ffd4f1c34f10d07b1a198eaad2030803d6f
Closes-bug: #1243193
'}]
commit_message:
VMware: fix image snapshot with attached volume

A snapshot of a instance with an attached volume will result in
the wrong volume being uploaded to glance. The reason for this
are as follows:
1. the last image in the list of images would be exported
2. the base image would not be exported but the first found

The same happens with a VM rescue if there is a cinder volume
attached.

The solution is to search for an image that contains the instance
UUID.

Change-Id: Ic85b0ffd4f1c34f10d07b1a198eaad2030803d6f
Closes-bug: #1243193

commit_message:
vmdk: To add missing time unit in driver option

Time unit is missing in the description of vmdk driver option
"vmware_task_poll_interval". Due to this, the vmdk driver config
reference document doesn't have the timeunit in its description
column. This fix adds the missing time unit (seconds) in the
driver option.

Closes-Bug: #1258100
Change-Id: I2c49c65ca9a48a2dcc6898a32b4bbc0433e8916b

reviewers: [{'_account_id': 3, 'name': 'Jenkins', 'username': 'jenkins'}, {'_account_id': 2271, 'name': 'Michael Still', 'email': 'mikal@stillhq.com', 'username': 'mikalstill'}, {'_account_id': 5292, 'name': 'Christopher Yeoh', 'email': 'cbkyeoh@gmail.com', 'username': 'cyeoh-0'}, {'_account_id': 6167, 'name': "Ken'ichi Ohmichi", 'email': 'ken1ohmichi@gmail.com', 'username': 'oomichi'}, {'_account_id': 7069, 'name': 'Joshua Hesketh', 'email': 'josh@nitrotech.org', 'username': 'jhesketh'}, {'_account_id': 9008, 'name': 'VMware NSX CI', 'username': 'vmwareminesweeper', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 9578, 'name': 'DB Datasets CI', 'email': 'turbo-hipster@lists.rcbops.com', 'username': 'turbo-hipster', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}]
revisions:
[{'number': 6, 'created': '2014-02-05 01:46:12.000000000', 'files': ['nova/tests/test_api_validation.py', 'nova/api/openstack/compute/schemas/v3/keypairs.py', 'nova/tests/api/openstack/compute/plugins/v3/test_keypairs.py', 'nova/api/validation/parameter_types.py'], 'message': 'Define common "name" parameter for Nova v3 API

Nova v3 API contains 'name' parameters such as aggregate, backup,
flavor, keypair and server. The validation way of each parameter
is different like the following because of just porting it from v2
APIs:

  Resource  | Length  | Pattern
 -----------+---------+----------------------------------
  aggregate | 1-255   | nothing
  backup    | nothing | nothing
  flavor    | 1-255   | '^[a-zA-Z0-9. _-]*[a-zA-Z0-9_-]+
            |         |   [a-zA-Z0-9. _-]*$'
  keypair   | 1-255   | '^[a-zA-Z0-9 _-]+$'
  server    | 1-255   | nothing

All of them are stored in the DB, and it would make APIs consistent if
applying the same validation way to all APIs.

This patch adds the validation way for all 'name' parameters.

Partially implements blueprint nova-api-validation-fw

Change-Id: I05391a03f383cac1d475cd4266cf7f5ced664f9e
'}]
commit_message:
Define common "name" parameter for Nova v3 API

Nova v3 API contains 'name' parameters such as aggregate, backup,
flavor, keypair and server. The validation way of each parameter
is different like the following because of just porting it from v2
APIs:

  Resource  | Length  | Pattern
 -----------+---------+----------------------------------
  aggregate | 1-255   | nothing
  backup    | nothing | nothing
  flavor    | 1-255   | '^[a-zA-Z0-9. _-]*[a-zA-Z0-9_-]+
            |         |   [a-zA-Z0-9. _-]*$'
  keypair   | 1-255   | '^[a-zA-Z0-9 _-]+$'
  server    | 1-255   | nothing

All of them are stored in the DB, and it would make APIs consistent if
applying the same validation way to all APIs.

This patch adds the validation way for all 'name' parameters.

Partially implements blueprint nova-api-validation-fw

Change-Id: I05391a03f383cac1d475cd4266cf7f5ced664f9e

commit_message:
Skip negative tests of v3 server metadata

If sending long metadata to "create a server" API of Nova v3 API,
the API returns an OverLimit response now.

However the commit Ic17d2227909c9180ca86c9d578dad4c73ec57dfc will
change the response to BadRequest. To verify the commit on Jenkins,
it is necessary to skip the tests related to long metadata temporary.

Change-Id: Ic03c2247505780fbeda68e908298a98862ea0c7c
Related-Bug: #1273948

commit_message:
Add create volume from volume

Cinder has the ability to create volumes as copy of a volume,
we should offer that as option via horizon, too.

This change also fixes bug 1272169

Change-Id: Idbded6ecd49ff097c063873352405ae2bd91715e
Implements: blueprint create-volume-from-volume
Closes-bug: #1272169

revisions:
[{'number': 7, 'created': '2014-02-05 15:45:11.000000000', 'files': ['solum/api/controllers/v1/datamodel/component.py', 'solum/api/controllers/v1/datamodel/assembly.py', 'solum/api/controllers/v1/datamodel/sensor.py'], 'message': 'Standardize Data types accross model objects

Following the discussion on https://review.openstack.org/#/c/69601/
this patch standardize the data types of resources for the model
objects. Link have to be replaced by URI.

In the component model, nested components are represented as a list
of IDs that can then be queried individually. The attribute
abreviated has been added to specify if the component has nested
components at more than one level depth

Change-Id: I58c8f95fb4fb170efb071b81d76bfe8012ad050a
'}]
commit_message:
Standardize Data types accross model objects

Following the discussion on https://review.openstack.org/#/c/69601/
this patch standardize the data types of resources for the model
objects. Link have to be replaced by URI.

In the component model, nested components are represented as a list
of IDs that can then be queried individually. The attribute
abreviated has been added to specify if the component has nested
components at more than one level depth

Change-Id: I58c8f95fb4fb170efb071b81d76bfe8012ad050a

commit_message:
Add -m memory option to setup-seed-vm

Add an option to increase the memory of the seed VM.

Defaults to 2G (same as configure-vm).

I've seen the seed VM run out of memory when provisioning
some underclouds... this should help in those cases.

Change-Id: I559ac235d8e4811f0ac44b545a69b90f0797bbad

commit_message:
Make sure report_interval is less than service_down_time

If service_down_time is less than report_interval, services will
routinely be considered down, because they report in too rarely.
Add check for service_down_time vs report_interval, if report_interval
is larger than service_down_time, automatically change
service_down_time to be report_interval * 2.5

DocImpact

Closes bug #1255685

Change-Id: I1be42e1826142b8f3f2c39f3734bef713a12a693

revisions:
[{'number': 9, 'created': '2014-02-06 03:58:39.000000000', 'files': ['solum/tests/objects/test_objects_sqlalchemy.py', 'solum/tests/objects/test_sqlalchemy.py', 'solum/tests/utils.py'], 'message': 'Make sure the alembic schema are run in the tests

We need to make sure that the migrations are run to get
the latest schema when the db is created in the new Database
fixture.

Note: alembic migrations do not seem to work with an in-memory sqlite
as the alembic command is run in a different process
resulting in no schema been applied.

Now we use a new sqlite database (tempfile) for each test and make use of the
NestedTempfile fixture to delete the file.

Change-Id: Iea7f5c90e91404a89bdd526f609f4352c7f5dbd3

commit_message:
Make sure the alembic schema are run in the tests

We need to make sure that the migrations are run to get
the latest schema when the db is created in the new Database
fixture.

Note: alembic migrations do not seem to work with an in-memory sqlite
as the alembic command is run in a different process
resulting in no schema been applied.

Now we use a new sqlite database (tempfile) for each test and make use of the
NestedTempfile fixture to delete the file.

Change-Id: Iea7f5c90e91404a89bdd526f609f4352c7f5dbd3

subject: Enable mysql_traditional_mode
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2014-02-06 00:44:18.000000000', 'files': ['solum/objects/sqlalchemy/models.py'], 'message': 'Enable mysql_traditional_mode

This is required to prevent silent truncates at insert or update operations
under MySQL. By default MySQL truncates inserted string if it longer
than a declared field just with warning. That is fraught with data
corruption.

Change-Id: I5007cac3501d50b9876d87f9f662e6e7dde03cb1
'}]
commit_message:
Enable mysql_traditional_mode

This is required to prevent silent truncates at insert or update operations
under MySQL. By default MySQL truncates inserted string if it longer
than a declared field just with warning. That is fraught with data
corruption.

Change-Id: I5007cac3501d50b9876d87f9f662e6e7dde03cb1

commit_message:
Refactored unit tests structure

Created SavannaTestCase class with utility methods. It allows to:
  * set up context for the test (set up automatically in setUp, can be overwritten)
  * override savanna config for the test

Created SavannaWithDbTestCase that sets up db automatically in setUp. It replaces old DbTestCase.

Closes-Bug: #1273457

Change-Id: I429f43df30bf12e6801a6c8f1bf00d9b09c8d15c

revisions:
[{'number': 5, 'created': '2014-02-04 18:03:31.000000000', 'files': ['nova/hacking/checks.py', 'nova/tests/test_hacking.py', 'HACKING.rst'], 'message': 'Add hacking test to block cross-virt driver code usage

The baremetal driver has been accessing some libvirt driver
private classes and config variables. Any code that is intended
to be shared across virt drivers should be in a common package
instead. Add a hacking file to enforce this for imports and
config options so that no further problems like this are made
in the future.

NB, this skips verification of the baremetal driver until
bugs 1261826 and 1261827 are fixed, or the baremetal driver is
removed, whichever comes first.

Change-Id: Ifbfe597795795a847830f9bd937dc459cd37d118
Closes-Bug: #1261842
'}]
commit_message:
Add hacking test to block cross-virt driver code usage

The baremetal driver has been accessing some libvirt driver
private classes and config variables. Any code that is intended
to be shared across virt drivers should be in a common package
instead. Add a hacking file to enforce this for imports and
config options so that no further problems like this are made
in the future.

NB, this skips verification of the baremetal driver until
bugs 1261826 and 1261827 are fixed, or the baremetal driver is
removed, whichever comes first.

Change-Id: Ifbfe597795795a847830f9bd937dc459cd37d118
Closes-Bug: #1261842

revisions:
[{'number': 8, 'created': '2014-02-02 07:31:25.000000000', 'files': ['cinder/volume/drivers/ibm/storwize_svc/ssh.py', 'cinder/tests/test_storwize_svc.py'], 'message': "Allow spaces in host names in the storwize driver

Storwize/SVC naming rules allow host objects to have spaces in their
names. The SSH injection filter will currently reject such names, and so
we surround the names with quotes. Please note that this doesn't allow
to have an arbitrary character in there except a space (anything else
will be cleaned up by the driver or rejected by the SSH injection filter
up the call chain).

Change-Id: If9aec40fe34293031f08d759dd930d73ead456f5
Closes-Bug: #1270204
"}]
commit_message:
Allow spaces in host names in the storwize driver

Storwize/SVC naming rules allow host objects to have spaces in their
names. The SSH injection filter will currently reject such names, and so
we surround the names with quotes. Please note that this doesn't allow
to have an arbitrary character in there except a space (anything else
will be cleaned up by the driver or rejected by the SSH injection filter
up the call chain).

Change-Id: If9aec40fe34293031f08d759dd930d73ead456f5
Closes-Bug: #1270204

Improve forbidden checks

New functions were created to check 'allowed' access because the previous design
was checking after changes were possibly made.

Changed the unit test to use an already created user to simulate the original
error that was reported.

subject: Revert "Allow deleting instances while uuid lock is held"
reviewers: [{'_account_id': 3, 'name': 'Jenkins', 'username': 'jenkins'}, {'_account_id': 1561, 'name': 'Russell Bryant', 'email': 'rbryant@redhat.com', 'username': 'russellb'}, {'_account_id': 3185, 'name': 'Alessandro Pilotti', 'email': 'apilotti@cloudbasesolutions.com', 'username': 'alexpilotti'}, {'_account_id': 4393, 'name': 'Dan Smith', 'email': 'dms@danplanet.com', 'username': 'danms'}, {'_account_id': 6873, 'name': 'Matt Riedemann', 'email': 'mriedem.os@gmail.com', 'username': 'mriedem'}, {'_account_id': 9008, 'name': 'VMware NSX CI', 'username': 'vmwareminesweeper', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}]
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2014-02-05 20:12:18.000000000', 'files': ['nova/network/manager.py', 'nova/compute/manager.py'], 'message': 'Revert "Allow deleting instances while uuid lock is held"

This reverts commit 08beabc5e0fc3fffc074a634040f5821d4d1d5f2.

This patch creates race condition issues in the Hyper-V driver
due to the fact that spawn, destroy and other methods have been
written with the instance lock in mind.

In this context, thread safety needs to be enforced where needed
in all drivers before this patch can be applied.

Sample Hyper-V CI log showing the error:
http://64.119.130.115/63217/7/Hyper-V/hv-compute2/nova-compute.log.gz

Partial-Bug: #1276772

Change-Id: I72fb1f9de7767b7206c5fa39b87216fa3f1b5c68
'}]
commit_message:
Revert "Allow deleting instances while uuid lock is held"

This reverts commit 08beabc5e0fc3fffc074a634040f5821d4d1d5f2.

This patch creates race condition issues in the Hyper-V driver
due to the fact that spawn, destroy and other methods have been
written with the instance lock in mind.

In this context, thread safety needs to be enforced where needed
in all drivers before this patch can be applied.

Sample Hyper-V CI log showing the error:
http://64.119.130.115/63217/7/Hyper-V/hv-compute2/nova-compute.log.gz

Partial-Bug: #1276772

Change-Id: I72fb1f9de7767b7206c5fa39b87216fa3f1b5c68

subject: Updates cinder-group-active script to work on Ubuntu
revisions:
[{'number': 3, 'created': '2014-02-03 07:55:01.000000000', 'files': ['templates/default/cinder-group-active.erb', 'recipes/volume.rb'], 'message': "Updates cinder-group-active script to work on Ubuntu

Setting the following attribute to true causes a chef-client to fail on
Ubuntu:

default['openstack']['block-storage']['volume']['create_volume_group']

The reason is that when this is enabled, the file cinder-group-active
is dropped in /etc/init.d and attempting to start it fails since it's
not written for Ubuntu.  This change wraps some of the Red Hat specific
bits with if statements and also conditionally runs the vgcreate so we
don't run losetup unnecessarily (which keeps mapping the volume file to
new /dev/loop devices).

Change-Id: I5e14aeec64b1c1d596584bfc5d3352f45114421a
Closes-Bug: #1274385
"}]
commit_message:
Updates cinder-group-active script to work on Ubuntu

Setting the following attribute to true causes a chef-client to fail on
Ubuntu:

default['openstack']['block-storage']['volume']['create_volume_group']

The reason is that when this is enabled, the file cinder-group-active
is dropped in /etc/init.d and attempting to start it fails since it's
not written for Ubuntu.  This change wraps some of the Red Hat specific
bits with if statements and also conditionally runs the vgcreate so we
don't run losetup unnecessarily (which keeps mapping the volume file to
new /dev/loop devices).

Change-Id: I5e14aeec64b1c1d596584bfc5d3352f45114421a
Closes-Bug: #1274385

commit_message:
Extract configs beginning with "edp." from job_configs['configs']

Allow configuration parameters beginning with "edp." to be extracted
from the job configuration during workflow generation. This provides
a consistent, extensible method for passing job-type specific settings
to Savanna which impact the workflow (but which do not appear in the
<configuration/> section of the workflow).

Implements: blueprint edp-config-parameter-prefix

Change-Id: I9641f8f84a4807646940e43e92370faae3460609

commit_message:
Upgrade/Update rubocop

Now that almost all of the rubocop blueprints have been completed, make
one final pass through all of the cookbooks ensuring they're all in
sync with each other.

- Upgrade rubocop to 0.18.1
- Fix violations caused by 0.18.1 upgrade
- Add Includes for non-existent folders to Includes so they
  automatically cover future additions

Change-Id: Ib3220a0ab8281bc0eafaf9898c233d90490cfde6
Implements: blueprint lint-and-unit-testing-for-havana

commit_message:
Remove get_instance_type and get_active_by_window from nova compute API

Commit 013b301c1c makes both methods vestigial since the
simple_tenant_usage API was the only thing using them.

Change-Id: Idbe8183760edd57b58564761c30f2f6e3ad0086e

commit_message:
Small tweak to the wordcount example README

Mention that the UI will prompt for main_class and java_opts. The
fact that these are set via "edp." parameters doesn't matter
because the UI will mask that fact from the user.

Change-Id: I1e3e273a7346944c10b68ea9401bb69e1fe60f64

revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2014-02-05 09:52:04.000000000', 'files': ['recipes/volume.rb', 'spec/volume_spec.rb', 'attributes/default.rb', 'README.md'], 'message': 'Make rbd_secret_uuid behave like a shared secret

This change makes rbd_secret_uuid behave like neutron_metadata_secret,
since it basically fulfills the same role in the exchange between cinder
and nova-compute.

Implements: blueprint rbd-for-block-storage

Change-Id: I7bda1c5e36ce661df70bdf91a70cbb2b2c8b6ac6
'}]
commit_message:
Make rbd_secret_uuid behave like a shared secret

This change makes rbd_secret_uuid behave like neutron_metadata_secret,
since it basically fulfills the same role in the exchange between cinder
and nova-compute.

Implements: blueprint rbd-for-block-storage

Change-Id: I7bda1c5e36ce661df70bdf91a70cbb2b2c8b6ac6

commit_message:
Use requests library in S3 middleware

Convert the S3 token middleware to use the requests library. It does not
validate certificates as part of this patch to keep new functionality
isolated.

Change-Id: I0f26c80a969b919de80410af0a80920bd8493191
Closes-Bug: #1275598

commit_message:
VMware: use .get() to access 'summary.accessible'

the key 'summary.accessible' is not always present in
property-sets hence use .get() instead of []

commit_message:
Add option for enabling debug logs only for OpenStack

A new option --debug-openstack was introduced to enable debug logs for
OpenStack components, but not for external ones (e.g. ampq).

Closes-Bug: #1207576

commit_message:
Disable libvirt driver file injection by default

DocImpact: This changes the default for file injection and key
injection with the libvirt driver. Most people should not need file
injection (the metadata server and/or config drive are more robust,
better options).

UpgradeImpact

blueprint disable-file-injection-by-default

Change-Id: Icff1304fc816acc843f8962727aef8bbbc7bbaa3
Co-Authored-By: Russell Bryant <rbryant@redhat.com>
Co-Authored-By: Steve Kowalik <steven@wedontsleep.org>

revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2014-01-12 13:55:50.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': 'Logging excepthook: print exception info if debug=True

Sync from Oslo: I349dc76320911600accc2acdb02d9d94710cfc85

Exception info is only printed by this function if verbose=True.
Since debug is considered a log level with more information than

commit_message:
Logging excepthook: print exception info if debug=True

Sync from Oslo: I349dc76320911600accc2acdb02d9d94710cfc85

Exception info is only printed by this function if verbose=True.
Since debug is considered a log level with more information than
verbose (INFO), exception info should also be printed when only
debug=True.

Change-Id: I3056188f5ec90fc3f04734b9fa01c6e968b52ec1

commit_message:
Configure security group when using ML2 plugin

Since the ML2 plugin can concurrently support different L2 agents (or
other mechanisms) with different configurations, Neutron developpers recommend
setting firewall_driver flag in ml2 configuration.

Change-Id: I62d0d1b2aac88a11e5f3e80e98953c71cfc98629
Closes-bug: #1262678
Signed-off-by: Emilien Macchi <emilien.macchi@enovance.com>

The jsonpatch.apply_patch() might raise different types of exceptions,
this patch improve the exception handler on the jsonpatch.apply_patch()
call to capture them and also creates a new exception called PatchError
to avoid replicating the same error message across the resources.

The patch also doesn't log the exception raised by the apply_patch()
anymore, since the problem will be returned to the client directly via
the API response.

In the chassis.py an alias "api_utils" was created to the utils module
to be more consistent with the ports and nodes resource.

Closes-Bug: #1271554
Change-Id: Ied1f5e573839520cc5f4e04548720f016f33349b
'}]
commit_message:
Handle multiple exceptions raised by jsonpatch

The jsonpatch.apply_patch() might raise different types of exceptions,
this patch improve the exception handler on the jsonpatch.apply_patch()
call to capture them and also creates a new exception called PatchError
to avoid replicating the same error message across the resources.

The patch also doesn't log the exception raised by the apply_patch()
anymore, since the problem will be returned to the client directly via
the API response.

In the chassis.py an alias "api_utils" was created to the utils module
to be more consistent with the ports and nodes resource.

Closes-Bug: #1271554
Change-Id: Ied1f5e573839520cc5f4e04548720f016f33349b

Some API tests were just checking whether a particular request would
raise a generic exception (webtest.app.AppError) or not, and this is not
enough, the API tests should make sure that the request will raise an
exception (expect_errors=True) and also check if the HTTP code returned
is appropriated for that error.

The FIXME left at test_remove_fail() is going to be fixed by a following

Closes-Bug: #1275812
Change-Id: I156749b3de0627c6d322192c397bbfe33919cf2d
'}]
commit_message:
API tests to check for the return codes

Some API tests were just checking whether a particular request would
raise a generic exception (webtest.app.AppError) or not, and this is not
enough, the API tests should make sure that the request will raise an
exception (expect_errors=True) and also check if the HTTP code returned
is appropriated for that error.

The FIXME left at test_remove_fail() is going to be fixed by a following
patch.

Closes-Bug: #1275812
Change-Id: I156749b3de0627c6d322192c397bbfe33919cf2d

given by the client. The auth provider can also return the raw

auth_data). The auth provider allows mixing multiple credentials
when decorating a request, possibly using empty or invalid credentials,
to facilitate negative tests.

specific set of credentials only require a single call to obtain a
token, unless the token expires or is forcefully deleted from the
auth provder.

Two implementations of the auth provider are included: Keystonev2 and
Keystonev3.  The Manager object behaves as factory of auth_providers,
building the correct one based on the configured auth_version, and on
the interface type (JSON or XML).

Fixes endpoint selection for v3 auth. Drops unused basic_auth.

and accept different combinations of credentials for v3.
Removes redundant server_client_v3_auth.

used. That is used when instantiating the client manager, and it
applies to all clients used by api tests.

Next steps (next patches):
- move to credentials as dict (as opposed to tuple)

  and create clients only when requested
- remove redundant CustomizedHeader object storage clients
- supports keystone v3 in tenant isolation
- use Auth Provider in scenario tests
- use Auth Provider in CLI tests

commit_message:
Multiversion authentication part1

Moves authentication from rest_client to an external auth_provider,
assigned to the client by the client manager.

The auth provider can decorate a request based on credentials (coming
from the client manager) and filters (region, service, endpoint_type)
given by the client. The auth provider can also return the raw
auth_data, which in the Keystone implementation is a tuple (token,
auth_data). The auth provider allows mixing multiple credentials
when decorating a request, possibly using empty or invalid credentials,
to facilitate negative tests.

The auth provider caches auth data, so that all API requests for a
specific set of credentials only require a single call to obtain a
token, unless the token expires or is forcefully deleted from the
auth provder.

Two implementations of the auth provider are included: Keystonev2 and
Keystonev3.  The Manager object behaves as factory of auth_providers,
building the correct one based on the configured auth_version, and on
the interface type (JSON or XML).

Fixes endpoint selection for v3 auth. Drops unused basic_auth.
Extends TokenClients to provide both token and auth data,
and accept different combinations of credentials for v3.
Removes redundant server_client_v3_auth.

Adapts tempest unit tests to work with modified rest client.

Introduces a configuration parameter for authentication version to be
used. That is used when instantiating the client manager, and it
applies to all clients used by api tests.

Next steps (next patches):
- move to credentials as dict (as opposed to tuple)
- expose a get_client method from the client manager
  and create clients only when requested
- remove redundant CustomizedHeader object storage clients
- supports keystone v3 in tenant isolation
- use Auth Provider in scenario tests
- use Auth Provider in CLI tests
- implement parsing of catalog XML format (?)

Partially implements: bp multi-keystone-api-version-tests

Change-Id: Icfa921e9051c01f339f8d2471b12d6ec950cc456

Make the simple_tenant_usage API use objects

and Flavor objects.

Related to blueprint compute-manager-objects

commit_message:
Fix import log_handler error with publish_errors set

Sync latest module log_handler from Oslo.
Commit Id is 2843a92a0e4007f50d5ad63d51fe574e1ba5e280

This handler sends the error to configured notifier.
The notifier could be any kind (log, RPC, no_op, None).

Note: when using publish_errors you also need to set the
notification_driver option too.

Closes-bug: #1240349
Change-Id: I4f759b049b8f34904ba11382a2e8fc1578677a8f
(cherry picked from commit f29f812bc64726b01a50590894d6d430c5f3d30d)

subject: 503 instead of 404 if account server fails
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2014-01-29 11:00:04.000000000', 'files': ['swift/account/backend.py', 'swift/common/db.py', 'swift/container/server.py', 'swift/container/backend.py', 'swift/proxy/controllers/base.py'], 'message': '503 instead of 404 if account server fails

In certain case the proxy server returns 404 masking errors in the
account-server or/and in the container-server.
Which are these cases?
1, If the {account, container}-server do not have the correct permissions
   to access its database files, it answers with 404,
2, When making request through the container controller in the proxy-server
   and the account-server is down it answers with 404, like if the user was
   not existing.
In each of these cases 5xx would be more appropriate than HTTP_NOT_FOUND.
This patches fixes the first case by verifying in
swift.common.db.DatabaseBroker.get(self), in
swift.account.backend.AccountBroker.is_deleted(self) and in
swift.container.backend.ContainerBroker.is_deleted(self) whether the servers
have the correct permissions, and if not, it raises a DatabaseConnectionError
with an error message indicating wrong permissions. For the second case the
fix verifies in swift.proxy.controllers.base.Base.get_info(...) whether the
response returned by either the account-server or the container server is a
5xx, and if it is, it immedietly raises an uncaught ValueError exception which
results in a 500.

Change-Id: Ib49a07c2a3cd34c82888503a356b613f777fa968
Closes-Bug: #1229382
'}]
commit_message:
503 instead of 404 if account server fails

In certain case the proxy server returns 404 masking errors in the
account-server or/and in the container-server.
Which are these cases?
1, If the {account, container}-server do not have the correct permissions
   to access its database files, it answers with 404,
2, When making request through the container controller in the proxy-server
   and the account-server is down it answers with 404, like if the user was
   not existing.
In each of these cases 5xx would be more appropriate than HTTP_NOT_FOUND.
This patches fixes the first case by verifying in
swift.common.db.DatabaseBroker.get(self), in
swift.account.backend.AccountBroker.is_deleted(self) and in
swift.container.backend.ContainerBroker.is_deleted(self) whether the servers
have the correct permissions, and if not, it raises a DatabaseConnectionError
with an error message indicating wrong permissions. For the second case the
fix verifies in swift.proxy.controllers.base.Base.get_info(...) whether the
response returned by either the account-server or the container server is a
5xx, and if it is, it immedietly raises an uncaught ValueError exception which
results in a 500.

Change-Id: Ib49a07c2a3cd34c82888503a356b613f777fa968
Closes-Bug: #1229382

commit_message:
Use ip6tables iff IPv6 support is available.

Consistently setup ipv6 related rules when ipv6
is available. Removes use_ipv6 option as its value
is auto-detected now.

Change-Id: Iff4b9d5d7376b272e4a3bf7a19b4cfaa9579de9b

In Nova, weight is using weight_multiplier() to get different weight
multipliers; In Oslo, it is using _weight_multiplier() to get
different weight multipliers. We should update Nova to change
weight_multiplier() to an internal method to keep consistent with
Oslo.

Also weight_multiplier() is an internal method for every class, so

commit_message:
Change weight_multiplier() to _weight_multiplier() for weight

In Nova, weight is using weight_multiplier() to get different weight
multipliers; In Oslo, it is using _weight_multiplier() to get
different weight multipliers. We should update Nova to change
weight_multiplier() to an internal method to keep consistent with
Oslo.

Also weight_multiplier() is an internal method for every class, so
we should set it as internal method.

This patch also removes one unused variable from
nova/tests/test_weights.py

Change-Id: Ifa1eba8368f85b80db4306089f286f01f9fc53cc

commit_message:
add bc to general RPM requirements

bc is not part of a standard Fedora 20 install and may be missing
in earlier Fedoras and RHEL as well.  A similar requirement was
added for apt-sourced packages in commit

121d65023b822fd4285d315386eedd023cbf223e

Change-Id: I371890121f82cee577dd25bea1d9bbf32ec7ec74

The cinder volume service crashes when a backend is not configured

commit_message:
add backend info and child process id

The cinder volume service crashes when a backend is not configured
correctly or reachable. There is very little information to go on
to allow the admin identify the problem and perform the corrective
action. We have added some info to help out with this issue.

Change-Id: Ia77ed80c62e5db7464b3ef9f3f9a13eb9788328e
Signed-off-by: David Medberry <david.medberry@canonical.com>
Signed-off-by: David Medberry <openstack@medberry.net>

subject: Set content length to 0 in case of empty body
revisions:
[{'number': 3, 'created': '2014-01-29 19:52:34.000000000', 'files': ['tempest/common/rest_client.py'], 'message': 'Set content length to 0 in case of empty body

Changes rest_client to set the Content-Length HTTP header to 0
in case body is None and method is PUT/POST/PATCH.
Some HTTP servers will return 411 otherwise.

Change-Id: I304cde691a02619b2514292ec196f80a9df0d4ad
Fixes: lp 1238536
'}]
commit_message:
Set content length to 0 in case of empty body

Changes rest_client to set the Content-Length HTTP header to 0
in case body is None and method is PUT/POST/PATCH.
Some HTTP servers will return 411 otherwise.

Change-Id: I304cde691a02619b2514292ec196f80a9df0d4ad
Fixes: lp 1238536

commit_message:
Implementation of protocol-agnostic HMAC based
authentication plugin

Any new HMAC based protocols can be supported
by having a protocol specific middleware
(i.e. EC2, S3, etc).

blueprint generic-signature-validation

Change-Id: I4c04ca5b4790c25f1aedadec605f5ca0b97f6a0f

commit_message:
Add "id" argument to the handler.update

create doesn't need an id as it gets created, but the update
like the get and delete need to look up an object.

commit_message:
Handle str not working when exceptions contain unicode

When a exception contains unicode, the usage of str() in
python 3.3 will cause an error, so try to use the native
python text_type first, and then only revert back to using
str() if that fails.

Change-Id: I4f36642453555c8e288cb67956d47bd0bcb8783f

subject: Use listener instead of AutoSuspendTask in test_suspend_flow
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2014-02-05 13:51:30.000000000', 'files': ['taskflow/tests/unit/test_suspend_flow.py'], 'message': 'Use listener instead of AutoSuspendTask in test_suspend_flow

Instead of injecting engine into storage (which is not clean, not
generally possible, and is an ugly hack) tests for suspension and
resumption now use SuspendingListener which suspends engine
when task with given name reaches given state. This gives us
cleaner and more portable across engines and persistence backends
solution for testing suspension.

Change-Id: Ieca80994bf4e2b6ee3a6249b644365136858bdd0
'}]
commit_message:
Use listener instead of AutoSuspendTask in test_suspend_flow

Instead of injecting engine into storage (which is not clean, not
generally possible, and is an ugly hack) tests for suspension and
resumption now use SuspendingListener which suspends engine
when task with given name reaches given state. This gives us
cleaner and more portable across engines and persistence backends
solution for testing suspension.

Change-Id: Ieca80994bf4e2b6ee3a6249b644365136858bdd0

commit_message:
Make sure that the db connection is used correctly

solum-db-manage uses a different global CONF object
to oslo.db, so we need to setup the olso db session using
session.set_defaults()

Change-Id: Id41c26fed883e2f92e397b4627938eb2af671f5e

reviewers: [{'_account_id': 3, 'name': 'Jenkins', 'username': 'jenkins'}, {'_account_id': 694, 'name': 'Tim Simpson', 'email': 'tim.simpson@rackspace.com', 'username': 'tim-simpson'}, {'_account_id': 739, 'name': 'Michael Basnight', 'email': 'mbasnight@gmail.com', 'username': 'hubcap'}, {'_account_id': 1375, 'name': 'Ed Cranford', 'email': 'ed.cranford@gmail.com', 'username': 'ed--cranford'}, {'_account_id': 2559, 'name': 'Joe Cruz', 'email': 'jcruz7@gmail.com', 'username': 'jcruz7'}, {'_account_id': 4240, 'name': 'Craig Vyvial', 'email': 'cp16net@gmail.com', 'username': 'cp16net'}, {'_account_id': 4954, 'name': 'Paul Marshall', 'email': 'paul.marshall@rackspace.com', 'username': 'paulvmarshall'}, {'_account_id': 5293, 'name': 'Nikhil', 'email': 'SlickNik@gmail.com', 'username': 'slicknik'}, {'_account_id': 7092, 'name': 'Deprecated Trove CI', 'email': 'reddwarf-jenkins@googlegroups.com', 'username': 'reddwarf', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}]
revisions:
[{'number': 3, 'created': '2014-02-05 19:53:57.000000000', 'files': ['trove/guestagent/datastore/mysql/manager.py', 'trove/tests/fakes/guestagent.py', 'trove/tests/fakes/nova.py', 'trove/taskmanager/models.py', 'trove/guestagent/api.py', 'trove/tests/unittests/guestagent/test_volume.py', 'trove/common/utils.py', 'trove/guestagent/volume.py', 'trove/tests/unittests/taskmanager/test_models.py'], 'message': 'Fixes resizes for volumes attached to active Nova servers

Currently, Trove fails to resize volumes attached to active Nova
servers. It also skips crucial steps such as unmounting and
mounting the volume and resizing the filesystem. When extending a
volume attached to an active Nova server, the guest must be
stopped, the volume unmounted, detached, and extended. Once the
underlying volume has been extended the volume should be reattached,
have the file system resized, mounted, and then the guest should be
restarted. If all operations complete successfully the task status
should be set to NONE and a usage event sent, reflecting the size of
the volume as reported by Cinder.

This fixes extending volumes attached to active Nova servers to ensure
a proper resize is performed and the task status is set to NONE and a
usage event is sent after all resize operations complete successfully.
Unit tests are also added.

Change-Id: I9a5785f539a2ee138ce1ded3cbd795ef91d66400
Closes-Bug: #1259976
'}]
commit_message:
Fixes resizes for volumes attached to active Nova servers

Currently, Trove fails to resize volumes attached to active Nova
servers. It also skips crucial steps such as unmounting and
mounting the volume and resizing the filesystem. When extending a
volume attached to an active Nova server, the guest must be
stopped, the volume unmounted, detached, and extended. Once the
underlying volume has been extended the volume should be reattached,
have the file system resized, mounted, and then the guest should be
restarted. If all operations complete successfully the task status
should be set to NONE and a usage event sent, reflecting the size of
the volume as reported by Cinder.

This fixes extending volumes attached to active Nova servers to ensure
a proper resize is performed and the task status is set to NONE and a
usage event is sent after all resize operations complete successfully.
Unit tests are also added.

Change-Id: I9a5785f539a2ee138ce1ded3cbd795ef91d66400
Closes-Bug: #1259976

commit_message:
Use an independent iptables lock per namespace

Since iptables is independent from namespace to namespace, it makes
sense to use an independent lock per namespace.  This improvement is
aimed at improving the parallel performance in the L3 agent.

Partially implements blueprint: neutron-tempest-parallel

Change-Id: I15e9c9da9a7c15981757a09bc744501722d62db2

commit_message:
Fix test case with wrong parameter in test_quota_classes

The 'id' parameter is filled in the quota-classes request body in
unit test, but it is not necessary. 'id' is passed to the server
by the URL but not the body. This patch fixes this bug.

Change-Id: I4014264e16031382277f6f1b520556a2a2690ad8
Closes-Bug: #1266634

This is for the same reason that SLO got pulled into middleware, which
includes stuff like automatic retry of GETs on broken connection and
the multi-ring storage policy stuff.

The proxy will automatically insert the dlo middleware at an
appropriate place in the pipeline the same way it does with the
gatekeeper middleware. Clusters will still support DLOs after upgrade
even with an old config file that doesn't mention dlo at all.

Includes support for reading config values from the proxy server's
config section so that upgraded clusters continue to work as before.

Bonus fix: resolve 'after' vs. 'after_fn' in proxy's required filters
list. Having two was confusing, so I kept the more-general one.

DocImpact

blueprint multi-ring-large-objects

Change-Id: Ib3b3830c246816dd549fc74be98b4bc651e7bace
"}]
commit_message:
Move all DLO functionality to middleware

This is for the same reason that SLO got pulled into middleware, which
includes stuff like automatic retry of GETs on broken connection and
the multi-ring storage policy stuff.

The proxy will automatically insert the dlo middleware at an
appropriate place in the pipeline the same way it does with the
gatekeeper middleware. Clusters will still support DLOs after upgrade
even with an old config file that doesn't mention dlo at all.

Includes support for reading config values from the proxy server's
config section so that upgraded clusters continue to work as before.

Bonus fix: resolve 'after' vs. 'after_fn' in proxy's required filters
list. Having two was confusing, so I kept the more-general one.

DocImpact

blueprint multi-ring-large-objects

Change-Id: Ib3b3830c246816dd549fc74be98b4bc651e7bace

commit_message:
Make libguestfs NOPRIME

The libguestfs requirement is only needed for nova libvirt,
not for all hypervisors. Additionally, libguestfs is not
installable on all systems due to a very large dependency chain.

Change-Id: Ib579f26dba7a16d8334be0cd74008644a2a8a551

The XenAPI driver does not have running CI and per the schedule,
is slated for deprecation in Icehouse-3. This adds the warning

commit_message:
Add XenAPI driver deprecation warning log message

The XenAPI driver does not have running CI and per the schedule,
is slated for deprecation in Icehouse-3. This adds the warning
message to the log to alert admins to this fact, in line with the
others we have been adding for drivers in similiar situations.

Change-Id: Iaff48aaca27d87c600291b8abcc23273a879366a

revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2014-01-31 13:18:26.000000000', 'files': ['savannaclient/api/client.py'], 'message': "Fixed issue when savanna url is not provided

* Now savannaclient takes savanna_url is as follows:
  https://HOST:PORT/VERSION/PROJECT_ID
  IMPORTANT! This URL pattern and only this is valid for client now.

* Old URL pattern 'https://HOST:PORT/VERSION' is no longer valid and
  exception will be rised on attempt to connect to 'data_processing'
  service

* Why this needed, because it's common OS approach:
  - base.url_for(ctx.service_catalog, 'data_processing') returns
    https://HOST:PORT/VERSION/PROJECT_ID
  - This bug blocks impl of bp savanna-as-heat-resource
  - Here we recieve https://HOST:PORT/VERSION/PROJECT_ID
    https://github.com/openstack/python-savannaclient/blob/master/savannaclient/api/client.py#L60

Change-Id: Iba98d2a57c0aa7900e3b4ec8bbc69b198e933db4
Closes-Bug: #1274913
"}]
commit_message:
Fixed issue when savanna url is not provided

* Now savannaclient takes savanna_url is as follows:
  https://HOST:PORT/VERSION/PROJECT_ID
  IMPORTANT! This URL pattern and only this is valid for client now.

* Old URL pattern 'https://HOST:PORT/VERSION' is no longer valid and
  exception will be rised on attempt to connect to 'data_processing'
  service

* Why this needed, because it's common OS approach:
  - base.url_for(ctx.service_catalog, 'data_processing') returns
    https://HOST:PORT/VERSION/PROJECT_ID
  - This bug blocks impl of bp savanna-as-heat-resource
  - Here we recieve https://HOST:PORT/VERSION/PROJECT_ID
    https://github.com/openstack/python-savannaclient/blob/master/savannaclient/api/client.py#L60

These tests use nova for floating ip which does not work with neutron so

Change-Id: I953a7719d7dc7b474142b3a59c09236af64dd808
"}]
commit_message:
Skip floating-ip tests in compute when using neutron

These tests use nova for floating ip which does not work with neutron so
they should be skipped for non-neutron runs. We did not see these tests
failing in the gate because they are not marked as 'smoke' and so are not
running in the neutron gate jobs.

Change-Id: I953a7719d7dc7b474142b3a59c09236af64dd808

reviewers: [{'_account_id': 3, 'name': 'Jenkins', 'username': 'jenkins'}, {'_account_id': 4571, 'name': 'Steve Baker', 'email': 'sbaker@redhat.com', 'username': 'steve-stevebaker'}, {'_account_id': 6488, 'name': 'Clint Byrum', 'email': 'clint@fewbar.com', 'username': 'clint-fewbar'}, {'_account_id': 7233, 'name': 'Matthew Oliver', 'email': 'matt@oliver.net.au', 'username': 'mattoliverau'}, {'_account_id': 7385, 'name': 'Thomas Herve', 'email': 'therve@redhat.com', 'username': 'therve'}, {'_account_id': 7761, 'name': 'Jun Jie Nan', 'email': 'nanjunjie@gmail.com', 'username': 'nanjj'}]
revisions:
[{'number': 8, 'created': '2014-02-02 20:29:10.000000000', 'files': ['heatclient/tests/test_template_utils.py', 'heatclient/common/template_utils.py', 'heatclient/v1/shell.py'], 'message': 'Populate files with content from get_file function calls

This is the client-side implementation of the get_file HOT
intrinsic function. The data for each resource is recursively
crawled to look for {get_file: <path>} calls. The content for
the URL specified by get_file is fetched and the content stored
in the files field in the API request.

If a relative path is specified, that path is converted to an
absolute URL, and that URL is used as the key for the files
content entry. The template is also modified to replace the
relative path with the absolute URL.

This implements the client-side portion of
blueprint get-file

Change-Id: If1da98578bb2919e3c8325442224376d3fadb0bc
'}]
commit_message:
Populate files with content from get_file function calls

This is the client-side implementation of the get_file HOT
intrinsic function. The data for each resource is recursively
crawled to look for {get_file: <path>} calls. The content for
the URL specified by get_file is fetched and the content stored
in the files field in the API request.

If a relative path is specified, that path is converted to an
absolute URL, and that URL is used as the key for the files
content entry. The template is also modified to replace the
relative path with the absolute URL.

This implements the client-side portion of
blueprint get-file

Change-Id: If1da98578bb2919e3c8325442224376d3fadb0bc

response_dict=None, headers=None)

Here is the commit of adding param 'headers' for Swift client, see:

commit_message:
Depending on python-swiftclient>=1.6

Now we're depending on python-swiftclient>=1.6 since the parameter
'headers' was introduced since python-swiftclient 1.6. This is a
regression issue introduced by patch:
https://review.openstack.org/#/c/48913/

get_object(container, obj, resp_chunk_size=None, query_string=None,
response_dict=None, headers=None)

Here is the commit of adding param 'headers' for Swift client, see:
https://github.com/openstack/python-swiftclient/commit/d34f12614820416aebe5e91eab9726b556d1f973

Closes-Bug: #1276033

Change-Id: Ibebf1d1ac8df9f35a7d5b5745eddfcdb00a036df

commit_message:
introduce if/then & for/do rules

we mostly have a consistent style on if/then & for/do in devstack,
except when we don't. This attempts to build a set of rules to
enforce this.

Because there are times when lines are legitimately long, and there
is a continuation, this starts off ignoring if and for loops with
continuations. But for short versions, we should enforce this.

Changes to make devstack pass are included. The fact that the
cleanup patch was so small is pretty solid reason that this is
actually the style we've all agreed to.

Part of a git stash from hong kong that I finally cleaned up.

Change-Id: I6376d7afd59cc5ebba9ed69e5ee784a3d5934a10

Switch to using a reader/writer lock scheme to
protect against simultaneous storage mutations,
typically seen when running in a multi-threaded
mode.

For the single-threaded mode provide a dummy
reader/writer lock which will mimic the locking
api but not actually lock anything.

Closes-Bug: 1273146
Change-Id: I954f542d9ab34b693e8da71c9fc913f823e869ba
'}]
commit_message:
Use reader/writer locks in storage

Switch to using a reader/writer lock scheme to
protect against simultaneous storage mutations,
typically seen when running in a multi-threaded
mode.

For the single-threaded mode provide a dummy
reader/writer lock which will mimic the locking
api but not actually lock anything.

Closes-Bug: 1273146
Change-Id: I954f542d9ab34b693e8da71c9fc913f823e869ba

commit_message:
Ability to create multiple volumes from cli

Added new optional input parameter --num-volumes
to cinder create which takes integer input parameter
corresponding to number of volumes to be created.

Added new optional input parameter --summarize which
provides list of volumes created similar to cinder list
instead of default verbose output.

DocImpact

Change-Id: I1768c9ad6ce6228f118f5c14c2e003dcc69478f3
Implements: bp create-multiple-volume-from-cli
